0.title: Charge less money, do more acting: Karan Johar on Varun Dhawan's b'day
0.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar wished Varun Dhawan on his birthday. Sharing a throwback photo featuring himself and Varun where Karan is seen kissing the actor as he held him, he wrote, "Let's get some publicity and wish you as well. Happy Birthday Varun aka Kuku. Live for a thousand years. Create commotion at...box office, charge less money [and] do more acting."

1.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi shares pic from her wedding with IAS officer Gawande
1.article_body: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi took to Twitter to share a new profile picture from her wedding with Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer. In the photo, the couple can be seen sitting on a couch, while donning a matching white outfit. The duo got married on Wednesday in Rajasthan's capital Jaipur.

2.title: Doctors remove cloth from abdomen of 25-yr-old woman at Thane hospital
2.article_body: Doctors of the Central Hospital in Thane's Ulhasnagar successfully performed a surgery and removed a piece of cloth from the abdomen of a 25-year-old woman. The woman reportedly underwent a maternity surgery at a private hospital in October last year, during which the cloth was left inside her abdomen. A complaint was registered against the private hospital for medical negligence.

3.title: Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya becoming centre of attraction for youth: PM
3.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the recently-inaugurated 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' is becoming the centre of attraction for the youth, which is connecting them with the precious heritage of the country. "The country has got a Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya...It's a matter of pride that we are remembering the contribution of PMs," PM Modi added.

4.title: Rape accused out on bail kidnaps victim's brother, blackmails Kota family
4.article_body: Kota Police arrested a 23-year-old rape accused who was out on bail after he kidnapped survivor's minor brother to blackmail family. Police said that accused, Ronak Dhobi told family that their son was in his custody and he would let him go if they withdrew case against him. Dhobi was earlier arrested a year ago for raping boy's elder sister.

5.title: Panchayats are pillars of Indian democracy: PM Modi
5.article_body: On the occasion of National Panchayati Raj Day, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the panchayats are the pillars of the Indian democracy. "Wishing you all a very happy National Panchayati Raj Day. Panchayats are the pillars of Indian democracy, in whose strength lies the prosperity of the new India," PM Modi tweeted.

6.title: Man stabs TN Police sub-inspector over month-old fine for drunk driving
6.article_body: A female Tamil Nadu Police sub-inspector was injured after she was stabbed by a man while on duty in Tirunelveli. Police reportedly claimed the accused was enraged as the sub-inspector had booked him one month ago for drunk driving. The accused has been arrested, CM MK Stalin said, adding that he has ordered a high-quality medical treatment for the sub-inspector.

7.title: It's the best spell I've bowled with white ball so far: Jansen on 3/25 vs RCB
7.article_body: SRH pacer Marco Jansen has said that his spell against RCB on Saturday was his best with the white ball so far. Jansen dismissed Faf Du Plessis, Virat Kohli and Anuj Rawat in his first over to reduce RCB to 8/3 after two overs in their match. "I enjoyed the third wicket the most (Anuj Rawat's wicket)," he stated.

8.title: Want Asian countries to change attitude towards Ukraine: Zelenskyy
8.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he wanted the Asian countries, many of which haven't voted against Russia's attack on various global platforms, to change their attitude. Stating that the European countries first underestimated Ukraine but their attitude changed later, Zelenskyy added, "I very much want the Asian countries to change their attitude to Ukraine as well."

9.title: Voting underway in France to elect new President
9.article_body: Voting is underway on Sunday to elect the new President of France. The contest is between the incumbent, Emmanuel Macron, and candidate Marine Le Pen, after they emerged as the top two contenders in the first round of election held earlier this month. Polling started at 8 am and will continue till 8 pm, as per local time.

10.title: Hindi is no more a national language: Kiccha Sudeep on KGF 2's success
10.article_body: While referring to the success of 'KGF 2', Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep, in a video, said, "[People say] a pan-India film was made in Kannada...I'd like to make a small correction." He added, "Hindi is no more a national language...They (Bollywood) are doing pan-India films today. They are struggling [to find success] by dubbing in [other languages]...but it’s not happening."

11.title: Centre to mint ₹100 coin to mark Delhi University's centenary year
11.article_body: The Finance Ministry's Economic Affairs Department has issued a gazette notification announcing the minting of a ₹100 coin to commemorate Delhi University's centenary year. The coin will be composed of an alloy containing 50% silver, according to the notification. One coin face will bear the university's logo while the other will have the Lion Capital of Ashoka Pillar, it said.

12.title: Pune policeman sexually assaults woman he met online, shoots her nude videos
12.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 34-year-old policeman, Vikram Ganpat Fadtare, for sexually assaulting a 30-year-old married woman whom he met on social media. Fadtare allegedly forced the woman to have sexual intercourse with him and shot nude pictures and videos of her with which he used to threaten her. The crime allegedly occurred between September 2021 and February 2022.

13.title: Kerala officials keen to implement our education model in their state: AAP's Atishi
13.article_body: Educationists and dignitaries from Kerala visited a government school in Delhi’s Kalkaji on Saturday to observe the education system there. They were hosted by Kalkaji MLA and AAP leader Atishi. "It was wonderful to host officials from Kerala at one of our schools in Kalkaji. They were keen to understand and implement our education model in their state," Atishi tweeted.

14.title: Not reached wave but hospitalisations lower than Dec-Jan: Delhi official
14.article_body: A senior health official in national capital Delhi said hospital admissions were low during the Omicron wave in December and January and that they are even lower now. "The patients who are in hospitals are those...whose medical condition even without Covid was critical and those...who have died of infection are also those who had serious co-morbid conditions," the official said.

15.title: 'Never Back Down: Revolt' actress Nitu meets Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
15.article_body: Actress Nitu Chandra Srivastava, who made her Hollywood debut last year with 'Never Back Down: Revolt', recently met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Minister of Industries Syed Shahnawaz Hussain on a two-day trip to the state. Sharing pictures from his meeting with Nitu, Nitish Kumar wrote, "I congratulated...her...for her performance in a Hollywood film. Wishing Nitu Chandra a bright future."

16.title: Can't address Salman Khan by his name; for me, he'll always be 'sir': Shehnaaz
16.article_body: Actress and ex 'Bigg Boss 13' contestant Shehnaaz Gill said that she likes Salman Khan's confidence and is fascinated by the actor's way to handle situations. Shehnaaz further said that she can never address Salman Khan by his name, and she will always call him "Sir". Salman and Shehnaaz were recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftaar party.

17.title: Happy to spend this b'day working, feels great to be up at 5:30 am: Varun
17.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who turned 35 on Sunday, wrote on Instagram, "It ain't my sweet 16, but super happy to spend this birthday working." "The last two birthdays were spent at home but feels great to be out here on set getting up at 5:30 in morning and reporting to Nitesh Tiwari," he added. Varun is shooting for Nitesh's 'Bawaal'.

18.title: 175 arrested over communal clashes in MP's Khargone; curfew relaxed for 9 hrs
18.article_body: A total of 175 people have been arrested so far over communal clashes that took place in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone during Ram Navami celebrations, police said. Local administration relaxed the curfew in Khargone for nine hours – from 8 am to 5 pm – for the second day in a row on Sunday, while night curfew continues to remain imposed.

19.title: Struggled for 15 months; didn't want dad to risk his earnings on my career: Vivek
19.article_body: Speaking about his journey, actor Vivek Oberoi said he struggled for 15 months to make his own mark in Bollywood. Vivek said he went to producers for auditions and stood outside their doors. "I...dropped my last name as I didn't want to use my father's (Suresh Oberoi) name." "I didn't want...dad to [risk] his lifetime's earnings....on my career," he added.

20.title: Not thinking about India comeback, my focus on IPL: Hardik Pandya
20.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya, who's currently the second-highest scorer in the ongoing IPL season, has said he's not thinking about his Team India comeback. "At the moment, I'm playing IPL and will focus on IPL, then will see where the future takes," he added. GT are at the top of IPL points table with six wins in seven games.

21.title: MVA govt propagating violence in front of police: Maharashtra BJP chief
21.article_body: After BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed that Shiv Sena’s "gundas" assaulted him with stones in presence of police persons, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil stated that now the MVA government is propagating violence in front of police. "The attack on Kirit Somaiya was not just an attempt to threaten him but to kill him," Patil added.

22.title: 40-yr-old farmer dies by suicide in Punjab; 14th such death in state in April
22.article_body: Depressed over low wheat yield, a 40-year-old farmer allegedly died by suicide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, police said. Punjab has witnessed 14 farmer suicides in April this year, according to a farmers' union. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised AAP over its pre-poll promise that no farmer in Punjab would die by suicide due to crop failure after April 1.

23.title: Virat is doing everything that is under his control: RCB coach Bangar
23.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form after he recorded his second straight golden duck, RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar said the 33-year-old is doing "everything that is under his control". He added, "But then you have an odd run-out or the first edge that finds his bat lands in fielder's hands." Kohli hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in the ongoing season.

24.title: Sachin batted just once on b'day in 24-yr-long int'l career, hit a century on it
24.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, who turned 49 on Sunday, batted for India on his birthday only once in his 24-year-long career. He scored 134(131) to help India win the ODI tri-series final against Australia in Sharjah on April 24, 1998. "I was tired but I had to give a gift to wife on my birthday," said Sachin after the final.

25.title: Saw Dhoni getting frustrated only once, he kicked his bag a tiny bit: Shane Watson
25.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said he has seen his ex-CSK teammate MS Dhoni getting frustrated only once when CSK lost to MI in IPL 2019 final. "I saw him halfway kick his bag a little bit...just a tiny bit. You could see how much it meant to him," he added. "No matter what the situation is...he's calm," Watson stated.

26.title: Money does funny things, it may have poisoned my relationship with Clarke: Symonds
26.article_body: Opening up on the breakdown of his relationship with Michael Clarke, ex-Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds suggested that Clarke might have become jealous when he became the most expensive overseas player at the inaugural IPL auction. "Money does funny things. It’s a good thing, but it can be a poison and I reckon it may have poisoned our relationship," Symonds said.

27.title: Ola Electric recalls 1,441 electric 2-wheelers amid incidents of EVs catching fire
27.article_body: Ola Electric is recalling 1,441 units of its electric two-wheelers in the wake of incidents of vehicles catching fire. The company said its investigation into the fire incident on March 26 in Pune is ongoing. Recently, there have been several incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire in various parts of the country forcing manufacturers to recall their vehicles.

28.title: 1 dead, many missing after boat carrying 60 capsizes off Lebanon
28.article_body: One girl was confirmed dead and several others went missing after a boat carrying 60 migrants capsized off the Lebanese coast, said authorities. Lebanon's Transportation Minister Ali Hamie said that 45 people have been rescued and the girl's body has been brought to the shore. The search for the remaining persons is underway, he added.

29.title: US woman falls into vault toilet while trying to get phone, rescued
29.article_body: A woman was rescued by firefighters after she fell into a vault toilet at a national park in US' Seattle while she was trying to retrieve her phone, which had also fallen in. The woman had disassembled the toilet and used dog leashes to get her phone, authorities said. A vault toilet has a tank underneath it to hold waste.

30.title: 2 class 9 students out for dip in cold water drown in Punjab canal
30.article_body: Two class 9 students, both aged 15, who had gone to take dip in cold water, drowned in a canal near Gurdwara Flahi Sahib on Ludhiana-Malerkotla road on Saturday. Police said the deceased, Vijay and Ayush, along with their friend Bhupinder, slipped into deep water after losing balance. While locals managed to rescue Bhupinder, Vijay and Ayush were swept away.

31.title: Explosives, detonator found near Chandigarh jail; bomb squad rushed to spot
31.article_body: An explosive device was found abandoned near the rear boundary wall of the high-security Burail jail in Chandigarh, following which police cordoned off the area and Indian Army's bomb disposal squad was rushed to the spot. Police found a small transparent box, a long codex wire, a small object believed to be a detonator and around 250 grams of explosives.

32.title: Told Alia to do Udta Punjab, director wasn't convinced she could do it: Shahid
32.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he had sent the script of 'Udta Punjab' to actress Alia Bhatt. "I told her that 'you should do this role' and the director was not convinced that she could do it because she has fair skin and she is city-ish kind of girl so he thought she's not right for the character," he added.

33.title: HC denies child custody to man accused of abetting wife's suicide
33.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has denied child custody to a father who is accused of abetting his wife's suicide. The bench observed that the crime would "emotionally devastate and destruct the growing years of the minor [and] will completely compromise her...mental growth". The man had claimed that his three-year-old daughter had been taken away illegally by her maternal grandparents.

34.title: KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell all the time: Parthiv Patel
34.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell to finish the games for them all the time. "It's going to be very difficult if you're depending on your number seven...even when you are chasing [157 runs]," added Parthiv. Russell got out in the final over when KKR needed 12 off 5 balls to win against GT.

35.title: COVID-19 was 3rd leading cause of death in US in 2021: CDC
35.article_body: COVID-19 was the third leading cause of death in US in 2021 for a second straight year, said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The infection was responsible for approximately 4.6 lakh deaths in the country, which was about 60,000 higher than the previous year. The two leading causes of death were heart diseases and cancer.

36.title: Ranas’ arrest display of arrogance of power: Devendra Fadnavis
36.article_body: Following Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's arrest on Saturday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that power has gone to the head of the state government. "The Ranas had come to Mumbai to recite Hanuman Chalisa. The state government’s act is a display of arrogance. It shows power has gone to its head," Fadnavis added.

37.title: Manipur media to boycott state govt, BJP news over unpaid ad dues
37.article_body: The media outlets in Manipur have decided to boycott news related to the state government and BJP unit over their respective unpaid advertisement dues from today, according to a joint statement by the state publishers and journalists' unions. Earlier, media outlets had threatened to boycott the state government, BJP unit and Congress unit if dues aren't paid by April 23.

38.title: Indian pharma should focus on global market: Mansukh Mandaviya
38.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said the pandemic taught India’s pharma industry to become self-reliant but there is a need to focus on innovations so that the sector grows and captures the global market. "We identified several Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients and started their manufacturing in the country. We now must look forward to be agile against the global competition," Mandaviya added.

39.title: Will reacted to his wife giving him the side-eye: Chris Rock's mother on Oscar slap
39.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at the Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "You reacted to your wife giving you the side-eye, and you went up, and you made her day because she was bowled over laughing when it happened." The incident happened when Chris Rock made a joke about Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's shaved head.

40.title: My bungalow is very expensive, couldn't be built by doing 4-5 commercial films: Nawazuddin
40.article_body: On being asked whether working in commercial films helped him built his new bungalow 'Nawab', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "My bungalow is very expensive. It couldn't have been built by just doing four-five commercial films." He further said, "There are some films I have done for free and I will continue to do this, if I believe in them."

41.title: Will be appropriate if Kejriwal uses decent language: Jairam Thakur
41.article_body: Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Jairam Thakur, said that it will be appropriate if Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal uses "decent language" in the state. "Kejriwal came to Mandi [for first time]...and went back without saying much...People of Himachal are patient listeners...they don't react much," he said. "Jairam is taking...leaf from the AAP's book," Kejriwal had said.

42.title: He really slapped me: Chris Rock's mother on Will Smith slapping her son
42.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "When Will slapped Chris, he slapped all of us, but he really slapped me. When you hurt my child, you hurt me." She added, "I feel really bad he never apologised. His people wrote up a piece...but something like that is personal. You reach out."

43.title: Was nervous, had a thousand questions: Yami on starting Hindi film career at 23
43.article_body: Yami Gautam, who began her journey in Hindi film industry at the age of 23, said, "When I came to...city, I was...nervous and had a thousand questions." The actress, however, added that despite venturing into an "unknown territory", she wasn't scared. "It all comes down to being yourself, being fearless about your choices, and just going for it," said Yami.

44.title: You made me cry like a baby: Ananya on Shahid's performance in 'Jersey'
44.article_body: Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to share a post appreciating Shahid Kapoor's performance in his latest release 'Jersey'. "You made me cry like a baby!!! Just the best," she wrote. Ananya also tagged Mrunal Thakur and wrote, "You're sunshine girl." Directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri, it's a remake of Telugu film 'Jersey', which featured Nani in the lead role.

45.title: UP woman's head tonsured by husband, in-laws as she refuses to leave home
45.article_body: A 40-year-old woman's head was allegedly tonsured after she was physically assaulted by her husband and in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. Her hands and legs were also allegedly tied and she was locked inside a room for two days. The incident allegedly took place when she refused to leave the house, which was constructed with financial assistance of her brother.

46.title: 3 RTO officials suspended after child died in Ghaziabad bus mishap
46.article_body: The UP government has suspended three RTO officials over negligence after a 10-year-old student hit his head on a pole while looking out of the school bus window and died in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The government action comes after it was found that the bus was running without a fitness certificate and was blacklisted.

47.title: Gained invincible power: N Korea's media ahead of military holiday
47.article_body: North Korea's state media on Sunday claimed that the country has gained "invincible power that the world cannot ignore and no one can touch" under its leader Kim Jong-un. This comes ahead of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army. Earlier this month, the country claimed that it had tested a new guided weapons system.

48.title: AAP claims Centre plans to demolish Delhi temple, holds protest
48.article_body: AAP on Saturday claimed that the BJP-run central government is planning to demolish Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Delhi's Sriniwaspuri and shared a purported notice by the Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry regarding the same. The party workers, including AAP MLA Atishi, also staged a protest there. "AAP won't allow bulldozers to run over a single temple in Delhi," Atishi said.

49.title: People say 'Don't you advise your son, tell him to do commercial films': Anil
49.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that it is difficult to make people understand when they ask him if he does not advise son Harsh Varrdhan and say he should tell Harsh to do more commercial films. "I say, 'He'll do...when he simply feels...he wants to do it...I don't want to tell him 'you do this...you do that, or anything'," Anil added.

50.title: India reports 2,593 new COVID-19 cases, 44 deaths in 24 hours
50.article_body: India has reported 2,593 COVID-19 cases, 1,755 recoveries and 44 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,527 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,873, while the death toll rose to 5,22,193.

51.title: Want to pay for my brother's education & grandparents' medical bills: Palak
51.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari said she wishes to help her mother with the family's expenses. "My mom has always been a sole earner, and I want to take that pressure off her back," she added. Palak said she wants to earn enough so that she can provide for her brother's education and pay for her grandparents' medical bills.

52.title: Delhi BJP to ask AAP govt to rename 40 villages
52.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Saturday said that the party would ask the Aam Aadmi Party-led government to change the names of 40 villages, which "are a symbol of slavery", in the national capital. The villages include Hauz Khas, Masoodpur, Zamrudpur, Humayunpur, Begumpur, Yusuf Sarai and Fatehpur Beri, according to BJP members.

53.title: Explosion heard in Jammu village hours ahead of PM Modi's visit to J&K
53.article_body: An explosion was purportedly heard on Sunday early morning in Jammu's Bishnah village, hours ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jammu and Kashmir. A senior police officer said a small crater was formed in agricultural fields following the explosion. Local villagers claimed the blast-like sound may have been caused either by lightning or a small meteorite-like object, he added.

54.title: We shouldn't have lost so many wickets in first 5 overs vs SRH: Du Plessis
54.article_body: Talking about their nine-wicket defeat against SRH, RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said they need to find a way to set the foundation while batting in the powerplay in their upcoming games. "The first [five] overs, we shouldn't have lost so many wickets...We just needed to get through that phase," he added. RCB lost four wickets in first five overs.

55.title: Which batters have hit the biggest sixes in IPL 2022 at halfway mark?
55.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis has hit the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far, which has a distance of 112 metres. PBKS' Liam Livingstone hit the second-biggest six (108 metres) of IPL 2022 so far against CSK's Mukesh Choudhary. RR's Jos Buttler is on the third position with a 107-metre six against DC's Shardul Thakur.

56.title: Boria Majumdar found guilty of intimidating Saha, faces 2-year ban by BCCI: Report
56.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been found guilty by a three-member BCCI committee of intimidating wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request, The Indian Express reported. BCCI is likely to impose a two-year ban on Boria and it will also write to ICC to blacklist the journalist. Majumdar had sent threatening texts to Saha, which were publicly shared by the latter.

57.title: Forced to buy ₹2-cr painting from Priyanka, money used for Sonia's treatment: Rana Kapoor
57.article_body: Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor has told Enforcement Directorate he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi for ₹2 crore. He added that the sale proceeds were utilised by Gandhi family for the medical treatment of Congress President Sonia Gandhi in New York. It was revealed in the chargesheet filed by ED in a special court.

58.title: If you try to help, you just get in the way: Vettori on Kohli's form
58.article_body: Ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori, on being asked if Virat Kohli needed some help, said, "It's easier just to say, 'Virat, we trust you completely'." Vettori added, "If you try to help, you just get in the way and you'll probably say the wrong thing and alienate him." Kohli registered his second straight golden duck in IPL 2022 on Saturday.

59.title: If Ravan offers CM's post to Shiv Sena they will go with him also: Union Minister
59.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane said that the Shiv Sena would go "wherever there is power and money". "Shiv Sena leaders can go with anyone. If Ravan comes and offers them the CM post for five years then they will go with him also," Rane added. His remarks came amid the ongoing loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra.

60.title: Having Arjun Bhaiya & Anshula Didi made us secure; I feel more wholesome: Janhvi
60.article_body: When asked how it feels like to have gained two elder siblings, Arjun Kapoor and Anshula Kapoor at such a later stage in life, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "Having Arjun Bhaiya and Anshula Didi as...part of our lives...made us more secure and stronger." "I feel more wholesome. At a later stage in life, we got two more siblings," she added.

61.title: Police arrests 5 gangsters from Ludhiana mall, nearby area
61.article_body: Police nabbed four gangsters from Ludhiana’s Pavilion Mall on Saturday evening while one of the gang members was nabbed from a nearby filling station. The gang had allegedly opened fire outside a house in Ferozepur on Friday, following which they had landed on the police radar. The gang had escaped after the incident and reached the shopping mall on Saturday.

62.title: Amit Shah failed to protect Delhi from communal riots: Sharad Pawar
62.article_body: Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah "failed" to protect the national capital from communal riots. "Amit Shah should have taken steps to keep Delhi unified and undivided but he failed to do so. You have power but you can't even handle a city like Delhi," Pawar added.

63.title: My bungalow is very expensive, couldn't be made by doing 4-5 films: Nawazuddin
63.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said his bungalow is very expensive and it couldn't have been made by doing four-five films. "There are some films...I've done for free, though, and I will continue to do this...if I believe in them," he added. He also said there are meaningful commercial films like 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'. "That's...film that makes you think...It unites people," he added.

64.title: Spent two nights at railway station alone: 'Lost' actor Pia on struggling days
64.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee, who'll be seen in filmmaker Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury's 'Lost', spoke about the initial struggling days when she came to Mumbai. She said, "It was tough for me to come to Mumbai. I spent two nights at...Delhi railway station because I had no idea how to reach Mumbai." "I didn't get a place to stay," she added.

65.title: Man says he's tensed after losing 'dream phone', tags Hyderabad Police
65.article_body: A Twitter user tagged the Hyderabad Police in his tweet, claiming that he has lost his “dream phone” iPhone 13. “I got that phone after hardships and efforts...Losing it within 15 days is horrible and [I am] tensed...Please help @KTRTRS @MinisterKTR @KTRoffice @hydcitypolice,” he wrote. Hyderabad Police asked him where he lives.

66.title: Philips introduces ThermoProtect Straightener to prevent heat damage
66.article_body: Philips has introduced the new Philips ThermoProtect Hair Straightener equipped with SilkProCare+ ThermoProtect technology to distribute heat evenly across the plates. The brand revealed the keratin-infused ceramic plates come with multiple temperature settings to reduce up to 30% of hair damage. It provides smooth and frizz-free hair with vibrant shine, making it the right choice, it added

67.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022 at halfway stage?
67.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler, who has slammed three hundreds in IPL 2022, leads the batting charts in the tournament at halfway stage, with 491 runs in seven innings. GT captain Hardik Pandya is the second highest run-getter till now with 295 runs. LSG captain KL Rahul, who was the Orange Cap winner in IPL 2020, is third on the list.

68.title: Veteran Malayalam screenwriter John Paul passes away at 71
68.article_body: Veteran screenwriter John Paul passed away aged 71 at a private hospital in Kochi on Saturday. As per reports, he wasn't keeping well for the last several months. John worked in the Malayalam film industry and had written nearly 100 films. He was known for writing screenplay for movies like 'Chamaram', 'Marmaram', 'Sandhya Mayangum Neram' and others.

69.title: Gangster involved in shootout at Delhi's GTB Hospital escapes from custody
69.article_body: Local gangster Mohit Badani, who along with his associates allegedly helped gangster Kuldeep Fajja escape from police custody at Delhi's GTB Hospital last year by opening fire, managed to escape from police custody at the Karkardooma court. Police claimed Badani is a member of the Gogi-Bishnoi gang and is allegedly involved in several cases, including murder, armed robbery and carjacking.

70.title: Thieves make hole in Pune mobile shop's wall, steal ₹52 lakh-items
70.article_body: A case has been filed after thieves allegedly made a hole in the wall of a mobile phone shop in Pune's Somwar Peth and stole 307 mobile phones along with other items. The stolen items are worth over ₹52 lakh, according to the police. The case was registered under Sections 454, 457 and 380 of the Indian Penal Code.

71.title: 21 on their way to wedding function injured as mini-truck overturns in Thane
71.article_body: At least 21 passengers, who were on their way to a wedding function in a mini-truck, sustained injuries when the vehicle overturned in Thane's Shahapur. "The mini-truck's driver was drinking water while driving when the bottle fell from his hand and went below the tyre. He applied the brake to stop the mini-truck but it overturned," a police officer said.

72.title: Asked to wash utensils, man kills roommate in Pune; arrested
72.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 28-year-old roommate after the latter asked him to wash the utensils late at night on Friday in Pune. The accused was arrested after their third roommate reported the incident to the police. According to police, the accused got enraged and attacked the victim with a kitchen knife, inflicting deep wounds under the chest.

73.title: B'luru CCB bust LPG cylinder refilling racket, seize gas cylinders
73.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru police have busted an illegal LPG cylinder refilling racket following a raid at a shed where both government and private gas cylinders were found stockpiled, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Raman Gupta tweeted on Saturday. He added that gas cylinders worth ₹7 lakh were also seized. Two people were reportedly arrested.

74.title: Outstanding performance by bowlers: Williamson on restricting RCB to 68 runs
74.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson credited his bowlers for their nine-wicket win against RCB on Saturday. "The guys bowled beautifully and we caught well. It was an outstanding performance...Marco Jansen has got the skills to do that, he's a real treat for us," stated Williamson. SRH restricted RCB to 68 runs, which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far.

75.title: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani break up after dating for over 2 years: Reports
75.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and actress Kiara Advani have broken up after dating for more than two years, reports said. "The couple has stopped meeting each other...The reason behind their separation is best known to them," a source told 'Bollywood Life'. "Their breakup is indeed disheartening," the source further said. Sidharth and Kiara had worked together in 'Shershaah'.

76.title: A day after buying e-bike, Andhra man killed in battery explosion, wife critical
76.article_body: A 40-year-old man, K Siva Kumar, was killed when the battery of the electric bike he bought on Friday exploded causing fire in his bedroom in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada city on Saturday. His wife suffered burns and was in a critical condition in a hospital while their two children also suffered from asphyxiation but were stable, police said.

77.title: I'm injured, Sena gundas assaulted me, wanted to kill me: Kirit Somaiya
77.article_body:
Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kirit Somaiya took to Twitter to say that Shiv Sena’s
“gundas” assaulted him with stones and wanted to kill him “in presence [of] 50 police persons, in compound/campus of Khar Police Station”. “I am injured...sitting in my car...Till action against police officials and...mafia Sena gundas is not taken, I will stay in my car,” he wrote.

78.title: Newly married couple, niece die as tree falls on 2-wheeler in Pune
78.article_body: A couple in their 30s, who got married only days ago, was killed in Pune in an accident after a branch of a tree fell on the two-wheeler they were riding. The man's five-year-old niece, who was travelling with them, also died in the incident. The police said that unseasonal rainfall might have caused the branch to fall.

79.title: Anupam Kher gifts rudraksha beads to PM Modi, shares pics
79.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher met PM Narendra Modi and gifted rudraksha beads to him on behalf of his mother Dulari Kher. Sharing pictures on social media, Anupam wrote, "I and Dulari ji will always remember the reverence with which you accepted the rudraksha beads sent by my mother to protect you." Anupam added, "May God always shower his blessings on you."

80.title: Twitter user shares video of crowd at 2 am in B'luru area, tags police
80.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of congested road in Bengaluru's Frazer Town at 2 am. "I have lived in Frazer Town my entire life and...I used to love eating food at Mosque Road during Ramadan...but this year people have gone nuts, Look at crowd at 2 AM @BlrCityPolice," the user wrote. Police said staff has been deployed for traffic management.

81.title: BJP high command to decide on Cabinet expansion, rejig: K'taka CM
81.article_body: Amid rumours about Cabinet expansion or rejig in Karnataka, Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that the BJP high command would take a decision. "I will get to know about it only after discussion with the party high command," he said. This comes ahead of the Karnataka Assembly elections next year. There are 29 ministers in the state Cabinet, including Bommai.

82.title: TMC's Mondal skips CBI summons for 6th time in cattle smuggling case
82.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal on Saturday skipped summons by the CBI in connection with a cattle smuggling case. Mondal, who was discharged from a hospital on Saturday after suffering from breathing issues, cited health as the reason for being unable to appear today. Notably, this is the sixth time he has skipped a summon by the agency.

83.title: ACB arrests two senior officials for accepting bribe in Rajasthan
83.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested two senior officials in Alwar, Rajasthan, who were caught red-handed accepting a bribe. The officials have been identified as IAS officer Nannumal Pahadia and RAS officer Ashok Sankhla. A sum of ₹5 Lakh was also recovered from the accused. Officials said ₹16 lakh was demanded by the accused in exchange for allowing construction work.

84.title: Couple killed by relatives for 'practising witchcraft' in J'khand
84.article_body: A husband and wife in their 60s were allegedly killed by relatives who suspected them of practising witchcraft in Jharkhand's Gumla district. They were attacked with an axe and sticks when they were in their house, police said. The man's sister-in-law has been arrested and booked under Prevention of Witch (DAAIN) Practices Act while her son's involvement is being probed.

85.title: Unconstitutional: Athawale on MNS chief's warning over loudspeakers
85.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Saturday termed MNS chief Raj Thackeray's stand on loudspeakers as "unconstitutional". Calling Thackeray a "militant leader" Athawale said, "He can put...loudspeaker on temples but can't ask to remove them from mosques." Thackeray threatened to play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers if the state government didn't remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

86.title: 21-yr-old Odisha man beats mother to death over ₹100 to buy liquor
86.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly beat his mother to death over money to buy liquor in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Friday. The accused demanded ₹100 from his mother and started beating her when she was unable to pay, police said, adding that he later fled from the spot. The body has been sent for post-mortem and police have launched an investigation.

87.title: US warns Solomon Islands of action over security pact with China
87.article_body: The US has warned the Solomon Islands that it will take unspecified action against any steps to establish a permanent Chinese military presence in the Pacific island nation. The warning comes after the Solomon Islands signed a security pact with China this week. There are potential regional security implications of the accord, according to a White House Statement.

88.title: My resignation permanently with Sonia: Raj CM on leadership change rumours
88.article_body: Amid rumours of leadership change in Rajasthan Congress, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that his resignation letter is permanently present with party chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot said, "The CM will change when it has to be changed and no one will get to know anything about it." This came after Sachin Pilot met Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday.

89.title: 3 killed, 9 injured after car collides with truck in MP's Guna
89.article_body: Three people, including two women, were killed and nine others were injured after the car they were travelling in collided with a truck near a toll tax barrier in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district. The crash took place on Friday after the car tried to overtake the truck, police said. The victims were on their way to attend a marriage ceremony.

90.title: 100 killed in explosion at illegal oil refining depot in Nigeria
90.article_body: Over 100 people were killed in an explosion at an illegal oil refining depot in Nigeria's Rivers state, a government official and an NGO said on Saturday. The victims "were burnt beyond recognition", the official added. Notably, unemployment and poverty in the Niger Delta have made illegal crude refining an attractive business but with deadly consequences, according to Reuters.

91.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused was planning to flee Delhi: Police
91.article_body: In the Jahangirpuri violence case, the Delhi Police said that accused Sonu alias Yunus was planning to flee Delhi in a bid to escape arrest. "He was planning to evade arrest and for that, he came out of his hiding to collect money, when police arrested him," the police said. Sonu was arrested for allegedly firing shots during the violence.

92.title: Ripun Bora appointed Trinamool Congress' Assam unit president
92.article_body: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee appointed Ripun Bora as the President of the All India Trinamool Congress Assam unit. TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee issued a notice which stated that Mamata Banerjee has appointed Ripun Bora as Assam TMC's President with immediate effect. Ripun Bora left Congress and joined TMC on April 17.

93.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read at the halfway mark?
93.article_body: At the halfway mark of IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 12 points from seven matches. GT are followed by SRH, RR and RCB, who have 10 points each. Defending champions CSK are ninth with just two victories so far, while five-time champions MI are on the bottom of the points table with seven losses.

94.title: BCCI announce venues for India's five-match T20I series against South Africa
94.article_body: The BCCI on Saturday announced the venues for India's five-match T20I series against South Africa, which will take place in June. The first T20I will take place in Delhi on June 9. The second T20I will take place in Cuttack on June 12. The remaining T20Is will be held in Visakhapatnam (June 14), Rajkot (June 17) and Bengaluru (June 19).

95.title: CCTV footage shows the moment CISF personnel's bus was attacked in J&K
95.article_body: A day after a CISF Assistant Sub-Inspector was killed in a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, CCTV footage of the moment the attack happened has been released. In the video, the bus carrying 15 CISF personnel can be seen stopping in the middle of the road in Jammu's Sunjwan area. It was then attacked with a grenade and rifles.

96.title: DR Congo declares new Ebola outbreak after detecting 1 case
96.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) on Saturday declared an outbreak of Ebola after a new case of the virus was detected in the country. The virus was detected in a 31-year-old male who died on April 21 in Equateur Province's capital Mbandaka. Around 74 of his contacts are being tracked, the Health Ministry said in a statement.

97.title: Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković dances to celebrate Narine's wicket, IPL share video
97.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković danced in the stands to celebrate GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami taking the wicket of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) all-rounder Sunil Narine in their IPL 2022 match. Narine was dismissed for five runs off five deliveries. GT went on to defeat KKR by eight runs in the match.

98.title: BNP Paribas trader fired for 'emotional terrorism' against staff sues for $4mn in France
98.article_body: Omar Alami, who was fired from his position as the head of BNP Paribas's equity derivatives sales for Switzerland, Belgium and Luxembourg in 2019, is suing the French bank for $4 million for unfairly dismissing him. The bank's lawyer has said that employees accused Alami of "emotional terrorism" and behaviour that left them with "a feeling of waterboarding".

99.title: Crypto is big part of future, people are looking at it the wrong way: Mark Cuban
99.article_body: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban told Bloomberg that cryptocurrencies are "a big part of the future", but "people are looking at it the wrong way". He explained, "They get really amped up about the price of cryptocurrencies, and...think that's really what crypto is. But that's the noise." Cuban said "the signal" is how crypto can help disrupt an industry.

100.title: Jaish-e-Mohammed militant from Pakistan killed in encounter in J&K
100.article_body: A Pakistani militant of the terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed was eliminated in an encounter with the Indian security forces in  Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam, police said. Kashmir IGP Vijay Kumar said that the deceased was a Pakistani national, who belonged to the JeM outfit. "One Pakistani terrorist of proscribed terror outfit JeM killed. Operation in progress," he tweeted.

101.title: 3 Pak soldiers killed in cross-border firing by Afghan militants
101.article_body: Three Pakistani soldiers were killed in a cross-border firing by militants from Afghanistan on a Pakistani military post in the North Waziristan district, an official statement said on Saturday. Several militants were killed in retaliatory firing by Pakistani troops, it added. Notably, eight Pakistani soldiers were killed in two terrorist attacks in the same region on April 14.

102.title: PSI recruitment scam will be thoroughly investigated: K'taka CM
102.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has promised a thorough probe into the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Everything related to the PSI recruitment scam will be thoroughly investigated and action will be taken against those found guilty," Bommai said. Karnataka CID has arrested 11 people in connection with the case including Congress block president Mahanthesh Patil.

103.title: Limit plastic bottles' use: Punjab health department to officials
103.article_body: The Punjab Directorate of Health and Family Welfare issued an order to its officials, asking its department to limit the use of plastic bottles and bouquets in Health Ministry events to reduce plastic waste. "The step has been taken to reduce plastic waste, pollution and to safeguard the public health," the order stated.

104.title: 4 arrested after BJP leader Jitu Chaudhary shot dead in Delhi
104.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four people in connection with the murder case of local BJP leader Jitu Chaudhary, Deputy Commissioner of Police East Priyanka Kashyap said on Saturday. The 42-year-old leader was reportedly shot dead around 8:15 pm on Wednesday in Mayur Vihar Phase-3. A police constable found Chaudhary's body in a pool of blood in front of his house.

105.title: Ex-gratia for soldiers killed on duty raised to ₹50 lakh: Assam CM
105.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the Assam government will increase the compensation for soldiers killed on duty to ₹50 lakh. "Our government has made efforts to recognise and compensate the sacrifices made by our soldiers by way of offering ₹50 lakh ex-gratia, jobs for next of kin...and reservation of seats for their wards in medical studies," he added.

106.title: Israel closes border crossing to Gaza workers after rocket attacks
106.article_body: Israeli authorities on Saturday said that they would close the border crossing for thousands of workers from the Gaza Strip, a move denounced by Palestinians as "collective punishment". The move comes after a series of rockets were fired from the Palestinian territory in recent days. "The re-opening of the crossing will be decided accordingly with a security assessment," they added.

107.title: SRH defeat RCB with 72 balls to spare, record 5th win in a row
107.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) by nine wickets with 72 balls to spare to register their fifth win in a row in IPL 2022. RCB were dismissed for 68 runs in 16.1 overs, which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. SRH chased down the target in  eight overs, with Abhishek Sharma scoring 47(28).

108.title: Nothing political: Bihar CM Nitish on attending RJD's Iftar party
108.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who attended an Iftar party hosted by RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday, dismissed speculations about changing political equations saying there was "nothing political" behind his decision. He added, "Many people are invited to such Iftar parties. What connection does it have with politics?" Notably, Kumar had last visited former CM Rabri Devi's residence in 2017.

109.title: Woman ends up sitting next to Anushka during Mumbai IPL match, her video goes viral
109.article_body: An Instagram user's video went viral after she ended up sitting next to Anushka Sharma during an IPL match at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. Raveena Ahuja posted an Instagram video documenting her experience of watching the match from the corporate box at the stadium. Anushka is even seen posing for Ahuja's video, which has garnered millions of views.

110.title: In these days of instant noodles, people expect instant justice: CJI
110.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday said, "In these days of instant noodles, people expect instant justice. But the people don't realise that real justice will be a casualty if we strive for instant justice." He was at an event in Tamil Nadu to lay the foundation stone for the Administrative Block of Madras High Court.

111.title: BJP MLA's sons booked for assaulting forest guards in MP's Sheopur
111.article_body: The two sons of BJP MLA Sitaram Adivasi have been booked after they were allegedly seen assaulting forest department staff in MP's Sheopur in a viral video. The incident reportedly took place on Thursday when forest guards at Budhera forest range's Piprani post stopped the MLA's sons from illegally mining stones. Police said that both parties have filed a complaint.

112.title: No break for next 6 months: BJP to its workers ahead of Guj polls
112.article_body: BJP workers in Gujarat have been asked to work without a break for the next six months after May 4 to prepare for the upcoming Assembly elections in December, state party chief CR Patil said. He added they'll not be holding any programs from May 1 to 4 and that'll be the "only break...party workers will get" before the polls.

113.title: 77,000 people wave national flag to break Pak's record in Amit Shah's presence
113.article_body: Over 77,000 people waved the national flag together at an event attended by Home Minister Amit Shah in Bihar on Saturday. The BJP sought to make history by breaking Pakistan's record that was set 18 years ago and a video of the same has also been shared online. The event was organised as part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

114.title: Delhi reports over 1,000 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day and 2 deaths
114.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported over 1,000 (1,094) new COVID-19 cases for the second straight day, after seeing 1,042 cases on Friday. Delhi also recorded two COVID-19 related deaths in the last 24 hours, while 640 people recovered from the disease in one day. The city's daily COVID-19 positivity rate is at 4.82%. Delhi now has 3,705 active cases of COVID-19.

115.title: RCB record their 2nd lowest IPL total exactly 5 yrs after recording lowest-ever IPL total
115.article_body: RCB on Saturday recorded their second-lowest total in IPL after being dismissed for 68 runs in 16.1 overs. Only Glenn Maxwell (12) and Suyash Prabhudessai (15) scored more than 10 runs for RCB. Notably, RCB had recorded the lowest-ever total in IPL exactly five years ago on April 23, 2017, when they were bowled out for 49 runs against KKR.

116.title: Aditya Birla Capital appoints Vishakha Mulye as new CEO
116.article_body: Aditya Birla Capital on Saturday said that it has appointed Vishakha Mulye as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). The company's present CEO Ajay Srinivasan plans to move out of his current role and take up another role within Aditya Birla Group. Mulye is a chartered accountant by qualification and currently an Executive Director of ICICI Bank, the company said.

117.title: Got similar offers after 'One Two Three Four', took break: Priyamani
117.article_body: Actress Priyamani has revealed that she took a break from the Hindi film industry after her song 'One Two Three Four' in 2013 film 'Chennai Express' because she only got offers for doing similar numbers. She added that she didn't want it to be like that. "If you enter Hindi cinema, you are there. It has a...pan-India audience," Priyamani said.

118.title: Man killed in EV battery explosion in Vijayawada a day after buying e-scooter
118.article_body: A 40-year-old man died and three of his family members were left critically injured after an e-scooter's battery exploded inside their residence in Vijayawada. Siva Kumar had bought the Boom Motors Corbett 14 scooter on Friday and plugged its battery to charge before going to sleep, police said. Kumar died of burns and suffocation while being rushed to the hospital.

119.title: People sold properties, ended up losing everything: Officer who probed Amway fraud
119.article_body: Telangana IPS officer VC Sajjanar who has been looking into Multi-Level Marketing (MLM) frauds by companies like Amway, has said that people who invested in such companies "sold or mortgaged properties". "[They] ended up losing everything," said Sajjanar. Talking about the 'MLM-craze', he said, "Families were being torn apart and the social fabric was breaking."

120.title: IAS officer shares pics of books she read for UPSC preparation, says 'each has its imp'
120.article_body: IAS officer Rajeshwari B has shared pictures of some of her notes and books she studied while preparing for UPSC. The 2011 batch officer tweeted, "Can't claim that I read all these books completely. There are many more books along with these. Some I definitely completed & reread. Some read once...Some referred as per need, so each has its importance."

121.title: Kohli walks entire way back with his head down after 2nd straight duck, IPL share video
121.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli got out for his second consecutive golden duck in IPL 2022 today. In a video shared by IPL, Kohli can be seen standing on the pitch with his head down before walking entire way back to the pavilion with his head down. "So disappointing to see Kohli go the whole way [like this]," a fan tweeted.

122.title: Cong, BJP both are responsible: Owaisi on temple demolition in Raj
122.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday said that both the Congress and the BJP are equally responsible for the demolition of 300-year-old Shiva temple in Rajasthan's Alwar. Owaisi said, "I condemn the decision. The Municipality Board was headed by BJP and Congress government accepted the decision to demolish the [Alwar] temple." "They [both] should apologise to the public," he added.

123.title: PM Modi set a target to make India number 1 in world by 2047: Shah
123.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a target of making India number one in the world by 2047, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Saturday. He made the comment at a function in Bihar. Separately, Shah, in a reference to RJD, said, "Mere avoidance of putting up posters of Lalu Prasad (Yadav) cannot erase...memories of the jungle raj."

124.title: Liquor mafia members surrender after being inspired by UP CM's work
124.article_body: Five people who claimed they were involved in the manufacturing and selling of illicit liquor surrendered at a police station in UP's Shahjahanpur on Friday. The five men carried posters that read, "Influenced by the policies of Yogi Adityanath...I'll never make illicit liquor again [and] that's why I have come to surrender". Four of them are history-sheeters, the police said.

125.title: Tour boat with 26 onboard missing in Japan after distress call
125.article_body: A sightseeing boat carrying 26 people, including two children and two crew members, went missing in waters off Japan on Saturday after sending a distress signal to authorities, according to local media reports. The authorities have launched a search for the boat. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida instructed authorities to use all available means in the search, a local report said.

126.title: GT jump to top of IPL 2022 points table, KKR suffer 4th straight defeat
126.article_body: GT defeated KKR by eight runs in their IPL 2022 match to jump to the top of the points table. GT have now won three matches in a row, while KKR have lost four consecutive matches. GT captain Hardik Pandya top-scored in the match with 67(49), while GT bowlers Mohammad Shami, Yash Dayal and Rashid Khan took two wickets each.

127.title: Indian wrestler Ravi wins hat-trick of Asian Championships golds
127.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist Ravi Kumar Dahiya won a gold medal in 57kg category at Asian Wrestling Championships in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, on Saturday and became first Indian wrestler to win three consecutive gold medals at the tournament. Ravi led Kazakhstan's Rakhat Kalzhan 12-2 and won on technical superiority. Notably, India won five medals on day one of men's freestyle bouts.

128.title: Virat Kohli gets out for second golden duck in a row
128.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli recorded his second consecutive golden duck in IPL 2022 on Saturday. Kohli was dismissed by SRH fast bowler Marco Jansen after edging a delivery to the slips. Kohli has now been dismissed for a golden duck five times in IPL history. Kohli has been dismissed for four single-digit scores in IPL 2022.

129.title: Affleck denies being on dating app after reality star claims they matched
129.article_body: Actor Ben Affleck has denied being on dating app 'Raya' after reality show 'Selling Sunset' star Emma Hernan claimed they matched. A spokesperson for Ben said, "Raya has confirmed that he has not been an active member for several years." Emma had said on the show that Ben asked her to grab coffee a few times but she didn't go.

130.title: Ola may recall a few batches of e-scooters: CEO after recent fire incident
130.article_body: Ola Electric's Founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said on Saturday that the company may recall a few batches of its electric scooters. He said that Ola has hired "world-class agencies" to find out the root cause behind its scooter catching fire recently. The company might do a recall depending on the recommendations it receives from the agencies, Aggarwal added.

131.title: NASA shares video of solar eclipse on Mars
131.article_body: NASA has shared a video of a solar eclipse featuring Phobos, which is one of the two moons of Mars. "It's the most zoomed-in, highest-frame-rate observation of a Phobos solar eclipse ever taken from the Martian surface," said the American space agency on the now-viral video captured by its Perseverance Mars Rover.

132.title: Will Smith can learn to slap comedians with legal cases in India: Vir Das
132.article_body: Comedian Vir Das on Saturday took to Instagram to welcome actor Will Smith to India with a joke. The comedian wrote, "Will Smith is in India? Good. He can learn to stop slapping comedians with his hands and start slapping them with legal cases." Vir was slapped with legal cases over his 'I Come From 2 Indias' monologue last year.

133.title: India is world no. 2 in most emerging unicorns, ahead of China: Govt
133.article_body: Sharing data on countries with most emerging unicorns, Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India is world No. 2, ahead of China among countries with most emerging Unicorns." While US topped the list, China is stated to have 27 emerging unicorns against India's 32. "Our robust & innovative ecosystem is enabling Indian startups to zoom into the Unicorn club," Goyal added.

134.title: Silver items worth over ₹1.25 crore stolen from Maharashtra godown
134.article_body: Silver valuables worth over ₹1.25 crore were reportedly stolen from a godown in Thane, Maharashtra. Police said that the incident occurred during the intervening night of Thursday and Friday in Pagaon village. "Thieves entered the godown and stole silver items worth over ₹1.25 crore. Following a complaint, a dog squad was pressed into service," a police official said.

135.title: All is well: HDFC CEO to shareholders worried about drop in stock price
135.article_body: HDFC CEO Keki Mistry in a message to shareholders worried about the recent drop in the company's stock price said, "All is well." Shares of HDFC and HDFC Bank plunged 18% each after the companies announced their merger earlier this month. Mistry said the fall in stock prices was due to lack of communication on the benefits of the merger.

136.title: Amravati MP & her MLA husband arrested amid Hanuman Chalisa recital row
136.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana were arrested on Saturday from their home by Mumbai Police. This came hours after the couple cancelled their plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. They have been booked under section 153 (A) (promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race etc), police said.

137.title: SRH to bowl first against RCB after winning their 7th toss in a row, teams unchanged
137.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won his seventh consecutive toss in IPL 2022 and elected to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. RCB are currently third on the points table, while SRH are placed fifth. The match is taking place at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai.

138.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner hosts Iftar party, shares pictures
138.article_body: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand hosted a Ramadan Iftar party on Friday. He shared pictures from the Iftar party on Twitter and wrote, "Delighted to share a moment of communion and joy with members of the community, dignitaries and friends during the Hyderabad City Police's Ramadan Iftar." Muslims across the world observe fast during the holy month of Ramadan.

139.title: He's very professional: Mike Hesson on SRH skipper Kane Williamson
139.article_body: Talking about Kane Williamson, who led SRH to four consecutive wins after losing first two matches in the ongoing IPL, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the SRH captain is methodical in terms of preparations. "He's very professional. He's obviously brought that team together after a tough start," he stated. SRH will face RCB at Brabourne Stadium today.

140.title: Karthik anticipating bowlers, picking up length early in IPL 2022: Shastri
140.article_body: Praising Dinesh Karthik's batting performance in IPL 2022, Ravi Shastri said the RCB wicketkeeper-batter is moving early and anticipating what the bowler is planning to do. "He's outsmarting the bowlers...he's picking up the length better than most players even younger than him," he added. Karthik is RCB's second-highest run-getter, scoring 210 runs from seven matches so far.

141.title: 95-yr-old woman fights off guard enforcing lockdown in Shanghai, video surfaces
141.article_body: A video has shown a 95-year-old woman fighting off a guard who was enforcing the zero-COVID-19 lockdown in China's Shanghai. The woman, who reportedly tested positive for COVID-19, is seen being stopped by a guard in PPE, using a wooden broom which she's seen grabbing and pushing to fend the guard off. She has reportedly escaped quarantine thrice.

142.title: MI seem to have had their soul ripped out at the mega auction: Kevin Pietersen
142.article_body: Referring to MI losing their first seven matches in IPL 2022, ex-England captain Pietersen said, "Mumbai seem to have had their soul ripped out at the mega auction." He added, "I just can’t understand why MI have weakened their bowling so much by using up a spot on an injured Jofra Archer and letting Trent Boult go elsewhere."

143.title: Society is ageist; if they don't need you, they'll throw you out: Anil
143.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor has stated that all professions are dictated by an ageist society, adding that it tells you when it's time to hang up your boots. "The world is such that if they don't need you, they will throw you out. In such a scenario, I thank God that I am still doing exciting work," the actor said.

144.title: Rainfall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
144.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, West Bengal and Sikkim over the next five days. Isolated to scattered rainfall is predicted in Kerala and Telangana over the next five days and in Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh and Tamil Nadu over the next two days. It's likely over Maharashtra in next 24 hours.

145.title: Kanye West raps about divorce, 'family in danger' in new songs
145.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has rapped about his divorce with ex-wife Kim Kardashian and ongoing custody issues in songs 'Dreamin Of The Past' and 'Rock N Roll'. He raps in 'Rock N Roll', "I ain't come to pick up the kids to pick a fight." In 'Dreamin Of The Past', Kanye sings, "When daddy's not home, the family's in danger."

146.title: Mevani arrested for insulting religious sentiments: Assam Police
146.article_body: Assam Police have said that Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was arrested for allegedly hurting the religious sentiments of a community in his tweets. "Primary offence committed by Jignesh Mevani under IPC 295(a) is insulting the sentiments of religion, through his tweets wherein he equated Nathuram Godse to Devata (God)," police said. The MLA was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday.

147.title: Iran resumes talks with regional rival Saudi Arabia in Iraq
147.article_body: Iran has resumed talks with its regional rival Saudi Arabia in Iraq's capital Baghdad, the Iranian state media reported on Saturday. Notably, Iran had announced the temporary suspension of the talks a day after Saudi Arabia executed 41 Shi'ite Muslims in March. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two countries.

148.title: Family focused on deep healing: Jada on Will slapping Chris at Oscars
148.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith released a statement on her talk show 'Red Table Talk' addressing her husband Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars. It reads, "Considering all that has happened in the last few weeks, the Smith family has been focusing on deep healing. Some of those discoveries around our healing will be shared...when the time calls."

149.title: Hyderabad is called the medical hub of India: TRS MLC K Kavitha
149.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha attended the Colon Cancer Awareness initiative by AIG hospital in Hyderabad. Inaugurating the centre dedicated to colorectal cancer patients, she said, "Today, Hyderabad is lauded as the Medical Hub of India. We are very proud of the medical fraternity, who constantly keeps in touch with the latest developments and tries to bring them to Hyderabad."

150.title: Deeply hurt: Ex-Pimpri-Chinchwad Police chief on being transferred
150.article_body: IPS officer Krishna Prakash, who was recently transferred from the post of Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner, on Saturday said that he's deeply hurt by the sudden transfer. Prakash said that he'll approach the Maharashtra CM and Deputy CM and find the reason behind his transfer. Prakash was transferred to Mumbai as the special inspector general of police (VIP security) on Wednesday.

151.title: Unknown persons vandalise idol at temple in Gurugram; police launch probe
151.article_body: An investigation has been launched after an idol was allegedly vandalised at an ancient Dadi Sati temple in Gurugram's Bhondsi by some unknown persons, police said on Saturday. The miscreants allegedly damaged the idol with a sharp object. Meanwhile, Karni Sena president and Haryana BJP spokesperson, Suraj Pal Ammu, went to the village and alleged a conspiracy behind the incident.

152.title: Video shows Tesla car crashing into $3.5-million private jet in US
152.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a Tesla car crashing into a $3.5-million private jet in US' Washington. The car could be seen pushing the Cirrus Vision Jet across the tarmac. The Tesla owner was reportedly using the 'Smart Summon' feature that enables a Tesla vehicle to leave a parking space and navigate around obstacles to reach its owner.

153.title: Actor Ram Charan attends Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav in Hyderabad
153.article_body: Telugu actor Ram Charan attended the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav organised in Hyderabad on Saturday to celebrate the 75th year of Independence. The actor placed a wreath to commemorate those who sacrificed their lives for the country and celebrated those who continue to do so and gave a speech about the Armed Forces. He also handed out mementos and certificates.

154.title: I've citizen's support: Bhimale on renaming of Pune's Salisbury Park
154.article_body: Amid protests by locals over the renaming of Pune's Salisbury Park garden in the name of his father, ex-BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale said he won't remove his father's name. Bhimale said, "I've the support of 90% of...people...[They're]...not interested in changing the name." The garden was initially named 'PMC garden', however, its name was changed to Prof Yashwantrao Bhimale Garden later.

155.title: Fast bowler takes 4 wickets in one over for the first time in IPL history
155.article_body: The GT-KKR IPL 2022 match witnessed the first instance of a fast bowler taking four wickets in an over in IPL history. Bowling the 20th over of GT's innings, KKR all-rounder Andre Russell dismissed Abhinav Manohar, Lockie Ferguson, Rahul Tewatia and Yash Dayal. It was Russell's only over of the innings. He recorded figures of 1-0-5-4.

156.title: India won't hesitate to cross borders if targeted from outside: Rajnath Singh
156.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that we will not hesitate to cross borders "if the country is targeted from outside". "India has been successful in giving out the message that terrorism will be strongly dealt with," said Singh. He added that the eastern boundary of India is currently more peaceful as compared to the western front.

157.title: Irfan Pathan shares pic of 'Preamble to the Constitution' after Amit Mishra's tweet
157.article_body: Ex-cricketer Irfan Pathan took to social media to share a picture of 'Preamble to the Constitution' after Amit Mishra's apparent reply to his tweet on India's potential to become the greatest country. "My country...has the potential to be the greatest country on earth...only if some people realise that our constitution is the first book to be followed," Mishra had tweeted.

158.title: I regretted not doing it on Shark Tank: Namita as she invests in Agri Tourism
158.article_body: Emcure Pharma's Executive Director Namita Thapar took to Instagram to reveal that she has invested in Pandurang Taware's startup Agri Tourism India. "My two regrets during Shark Tank were Jugaadu Kamlesh & Pandurang Taware, two incredible farmers from Maharashtra. Today I have invested in Pandurang's company," Thapar said. Taware is known as the Father of Agri Tourism Concept in India.

159.title: It was incredible watching him bat vs DC: Padikkal on fellow opener Buttler
159.article_body: RR opener Devdutt Padikkal (54), who formed a 155-run opening wicket partnership with Jos Buttler (116) against DC in ongoing IPL, said it was "incredible" watching the fellow opener bat. "He is playing the best cricket anyone has in IPL. To see him enjoy himself and go after the bowling from ball one is great to watch," he added.

160.title: 5 prime accused of Jahangirpuri violence sent to 8-day police custody
160.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday sent Jahangirpuri violence's five prime accused, who were charged under stringent National Security Act, to eight-day police custody. These five accused are Ansar, Salim, Dilshad, Sonu and Ahir. Meanwhile, the four other accused have been sent to judicial custody for 14 days. Notably, clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri last week.

161.title: Store charges man ₹12 for carry bag, ordered to pay ₹21,000 compensation in Andhra
161.article_body: Visakhapatnam District Consumers Commission in Andhra Pradesh recently ordered a multi-brand clothing retailer to pay ₹21,000 as compensation to a customer for charging ₹12 for a carry bag. It was also ordered to pay ₹1,500 towards legal cost. The store manager had reportedly shouted at the customer after he explained it was illegal to charge for bags advertising the store.

162.title: Last over of match was topsy-turvy vs DC: Ashwin after RR's 15-run win
162.article_body: Following RR's 15-run win against DC in IPL 2022, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said last over of the match was "topsy-turvy", adding he was having his fingers crossed. With DC needing 36 runs to win in last over, batter Rovman Powell hit three sixes in first three balls and then scored only two before getting out on the final ball.

163.title: Razing of religious places, poor's houses weakens our Constitution: Mayawati
163.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati has criticised the demolition of "religious places and residences of the poor" done by state governments of both, the BJP and Congress. "In (Congress-ruled) Rajasthan, demolition of a temple under the guise of encroachment and residences of poor in BJP-ruled state in the name of encroachment is disgusting politics. It weakens our Constitution," Mayawati tweeted.

164.title: What's wrong if Pune's Salisbury Park gets named after my father: Shrinath
164.article_body: In the ongoing protest by a section of residents against the Pune's Salisbury Park being renamed after Late Yashwant Bhimale, his son and former BJP corporator Shrinath has spoken out against the protest. "It (protest) is orchestrated by a handful of people. Besides, my father...worked relentlessly for the citizens...What is wrong if the garden gets my father's name," Shrinath asked.

165.title: Pak reports 1st polio case in 15 months, PM to chair emergency meet
165.article_body: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif has said that he will chair an emergency meeting of the National Task Force for Polio Eradication after authorities detected the country's first case of the debilitating neurodegenerative disease in 15 months. The case was detected in a 15-month-old boy in Pakistan's North Waziristan, the health officials said. The boy has been paralyzed, they added.

166.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna's first looks from 'Animal' leaked
166.article_body: A video revealing Ranbir Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna's looks for their upcoming film 'Animal' has gone viral on social media. In the video, which was shot in Himachal Pradesh's Manali, Ranbir can be seen in a white kurta-pyjama, while Rashmika can be seen in a saree. The Sandeep Reddy Vanga directorial will also feature Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

167.title: Kohli has fire in his belly and passion, my team is RCB: Harry Kane
167.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane said he supports RCB in IPL, adding that former RCB captain Virat Kohli has "fire in his belly" and passion which is great to see. "Kohli is incredible. [He is] a real down to earth guy," stated Kane. "I have been lucky enough to meet Kohli a few times and speak with him," said Kane.

168.title: Russia claims it shot down Ukrainian fighter jet in Kharkiv region
168.article_body: Russian forces have shot down a Ukrainian Su-25 fighter jet in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. Russian forces have also destroyed three MI-8 helicopters belonging to the Ukrainian forces at an airfield in the region, the ministry added. However, there was no immediate reaction from Ukraine regarding the Russian claims.

169.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX becomes largest employer in a US city
169.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX is now the "largest private employer" in the US city of Brownsville following an investment of $430 million on operations in 2021, according to a Houston Chronicle report. Brownsville Mayor Trey Mendez said SpaceX expects to contribute $885 million in gross economic output for Cameron County. SpaceX's Boca Chica launch site is located in Cameron County.

170.title: Man makes PowerPoint presentation for lost bag after Irish airline misplaces it
170.article_body: A passenger who was travelling to London after his wedding, placed AirTags in his different baggage in order to track their location. After having lost one bag, he repeatedly contacted the Irish carrier Aer Lingus for it and after not receiving any reply, he made a PowerPoint presentation showing where his bag had travelled to and shared it on Twitter.

171.title: Koratala Siva confirms films with Mahesh Babu, Ram Charan & Allu Arjun
171.article_body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, known for directing 'Bharat Ane Nenu', spoke about his upcoming projects and said, "I have one film that will be with Mahesh Babu, those announcements will be coming." "One will be with Charan (Ram Charan), one will be with Allu Arjun," he added. Koratala's 'Acharya', which stars Chiranjeevi, will release on April 29.

172.title: Hardik's showing discipline with the bat, his thinking cap's on: Gavaskar
172.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said GT captain Hardik Pandya is showing discipline while batting in IPL 2022, adding that his "thinking cap" is on. "Hardik is batting well in the powerplay and making full use of the field restrictions," stated Gavaskar. Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said Hardik has learnt the "right lessons" from MS Dhoni whom he is very close to.

173.title: Expect Root to continue his brilliance with bat in Tests: Ben Stokes
173.article_body: English all-rounder Ben Stokes has said that he expects batter Joe Root to continue his "brilliance" after the latter resigned as the captain of the English Test side last week. "Now that he (Root) has stood down, I fully expect him to continue his brilliance with bat...and show why he is the greatest batsman we've ever produced," Stokes said.

174.title: BJP MP demands apology from Raj CM on 300-yr-old temple's demolition
174.article_body: After a 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar, a delegation led by BJP MP Swami Sumedhanand Saraswati visited the spot to take stock of the situation. Saraswati demanded an apology from Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on the incident, adding that an FIR should be registered against the officials responsible. He further demanded that the temple should be reconstructed.

175.title: Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here: Sanjay Raut
175.article_body: Reacting to MP Navneet Rana's threat of chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's residence, 'Matoshree' in Mumbai, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said, "If you try to come to our residence, then we also have the right to answer in the same language." "Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here," Raut added.
