176.title: After Shiva temple, Gaushala demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar
176.article_body: A 'gaushala' (cow shelter) was reportedly demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar district on Saturday, just a day after a 300-year-old Shiva temple was allegedly bulldozed in the same district as a part of an anti-encroachment drive. Blaming Congress government for the demolitions, BJP MP Swami Sumedhanand Saraswati said, "We demand an FIR should be registered against the officials who did this."

177.title: 7 doctors of Maha govt hospital booked for medical negligence over 16-yr-old's death
177.article_body: Seven doctors of the government medical college and hospital in Maharashtra's Yavatmal have been booked for medical negligence over the death of a 16-year-old boy last year, police said. The boy's mother claimed her son, who was suffering from sickle cell disease, was shifted from one ward to another. He was subsequently moved to the medicine ward, where he died.

178.title: Avika Gor to star in Vikram's '1920 - Horrors of...'; Krishna Bhatt to direct
178.article_body: 'Balika Vadhu' actress Avika Gor is set to star in '1920 - Horrors of the Heart', an upcoming film which will be produced by Vikram Bhatt and directed by his daughter, Krishna Bhatt. It is penned by Mahesh Bhatt. Krishna, taking to Instagram, wrote, "Super excited to be making this one with my heart...and my mentors Vikram and Mahesh Bhatt."

179.title: Pornography course where students will 'watch porn films' offered by US college
179.article_body: A college in the US is offering a course on pornography, as a part of which students will "watch pornographic films together and discuss sexualisation of race, class and gender". The Westminster College course catalogue said that the elective course will study "hardcore pornography", which is "as American as apple pie and more popular than Sunday night football".

180.title: Why was the full-toss bowled by RR against DC not referred to third umpire?
180.article_body: On-field umpires didn't refer the full-toss bowled by RR in last over against DC to third umpire to check whether it was waist high, resulting in a controversy. As per IPL playing conditions, had the batter been dismissed on that delivery, the umpires could've referred it to third umpire. Umpires can refer to the third umpire only for front-foot no-balls.

181.title: Which batters have scored the most runs in first 7 matches of an IPL season?
181.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler has set the record for scoring the most runs in first seven matches of an IPL season. He set the record after aggregating 491 runs in his first seven matches of IPL 2022. The previous record was held by Chris Gayle, who scored 436 runs in IPL 2011. Glenn Maxwell follows Gayle, with 435 runs in 2014.

182.title: I was totally shocked: Rashid on reception from crowd in Dehradun during T20I
182.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the reception from the crowd in Dehradun during a T20I between Afghanistan and Bangladesh, Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan said, "I was totally shocked...The way they were cheering my name...was unbelievable." "That time will never go away from my mind," added Rashid. Rashid is representing GT in IPL 2022 and has picked six wickets so far.

183.title: US crypto-mining firm looks to sell gear worth $30 mn stuck in Russia
183.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency-mining firm Compass Mining is seeking to sell gear worth $30 million in Siberia after one of its rivals got sanctioned by the US over Russian operations. It's seeking to sell its mining equipment with 12 megawatts of capacity that can't be moved out of Russia. It will distribute the proceeds to about 2,000 clients that own the gear.

184.title: 'Anti-minority' image can hurt Indian companies: Raghuram Rajan
184.article_body: RBI's ex-Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that "anti-minority" image could damage the market for Indian products and result in foreign governments perceiving India as an unreliable partner. "If we're seen as a democracy treating our citizens respectfully...we become much more sympathetic. (Consumers say) 'I'm buying this stuff from this country which is trying to do the right thing'," he said.

185.title: Binance denies report of it agreeing to share user data with Russia
185.article_body: Binance has responded to a Reuters report which claimed it agreed to give users' data to Russian FSB-linked agency Rosfin, saying it's a false claim. "Inaccurate article by irresponsible journalists," Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said. The report had also said around the time Binance executive met Rosfin in 2021, Rosfin was seeking to trace Bitcoin funding of Kremlin-critic Alexey Navalny.

186.title: Tamil Nadu to set up 600 village secretariats: CM MK Stalin
186.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday announced that 600 village secretariats will be set up for effective implementation of various government schemes. The village secretariats would have a chamber for the village panchayat president, conference halls and offices for other officials, and each of them would be constructed at an estimated cost of ₹40 lakh each, Stalin added.

187.title: Woman jumps from 8th floor to escape man with 'ghost gun' in US
187.article_body: A US woman is in critical condition after she jumped from the eighth floor of an apartment building to escape an attacker with a "ghost gun", who had bound her arms and legs, police said. "Prior to the victim's fall, the victim and suspect were involved in a dispute," police added. The accused, who'd fled the scene, has been arrested.

188.title: 40 hospitalised due to food poisoning after eating at feast in Odisha village
188.article_body: As many as 40 persons were hospitalised due to food poisoning after consuming food at a feast during a function in a village in Odisha. The patients were initially admitted to a local hospital in Jajpur and later 10 of them were referred to the district hospital. According to a doctor at the district hospital, the patients' conditions are better.

189.title: Watched Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' 4-5 times in theatre: Mrunal
189.article_body: Mrunal Thakur in an interview praised Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', saying that she watched the film four-five times in a theatre. She added she wanted to be a part of the film as it "felt very personal". "It was such a bold...subject. This is how I started my career, with a film based on brothels and sex trafficking," said Mrunal.

190.title: I seek films to push me out of comfort zone, KGF 2 is that film: Sanjay
190.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt on Saturday shared a note on social media writing that he seeks out films which push him out of his comfort zone, adding that 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' is that film. He further wrote, "This film will always be a reminder that every time life pops a surprise, you have it in you to do better than that."

191.title: New Zealand reports first case of 'XE' COVID-19 variant
191.article_body: New Zealand has reported its first case of COVID-19 variant, 'XE', the country's Health Ministry said on Saturday. The variant, a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, was found in a person who'd arrived in New Zealand from overseas, it added. "XE has been spreading overseas, and its arrival in New Zealand isn't unexpected," the ministry said.

192.title: I would've been absolutely furious: Cutting on no-ball call in RR-DC match
192.article_body: Reacting to umpires not checking with the third umpire for a potential waist-high no-ball in the final over of DC's match against RR, ex-KKR all-rounder Ben Cutting said, "If I was the batter, I would have been absolutely furious." "[I would've]...probably given the umpires both barrels," added Cutting. DC captain Rishabh Pant was seen calling the team's batters back.

193.title: Pune civic body starts cleanup of Pashan lake
193.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has started cleanup of Pashan lake in the city in an effort to restore the water body, an official said. The workers are removing water hyacinth and construction debris from the lake, according to a report. After the cleanup, an approach will be developed for hyacinth management, a lake restoration panel member said.

194.title: Iran Revolutionary Guard General survives as gunmen kill his bodyguard
194.article_body: Gunmen on Saturday morning opened fire on a car carrying the General of Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, killing a bodyguard, state media reported. The attack on Brigadier General Hossein Almassi reportedly took place near a checkpoint in the provincial capital Zahedan. Almassi wasn't injured in the attack, the official news agency IRNA said, adding the attackers have been arrested.

195.title: As an Australian, I would hate to pick Karthik for T20 WC 2022: Lynn
195.article_body: Discussing wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Australian opener Chris Lynn said, "As an Australian, [I would] hate to pick Karthik because he is such a...weapon for them." "Karthik can just go and whack the ball," added Lynn. Karthik is representing RCB in IPL 2022 where his current strike rate is 205.88.

196.title: Woman dies after husband smashes her face onto floor in Delhi
196.article_body: A 32-year-old woman, a native of Jharkhand, died after her 35-year-old husband allegedly punched and repeatedly smashed her face onto the floor in Delhi, police said. The incident took place at the husband's brother's house in Budhpur when a scuffle broke out between the couple, police added. The husband has been arrested and sent to judicial custody, police further said.

197.title: Cannot implement ₹24,713-cr deal with Future Group: Reliance
197.article_body: Reliance Industries on Saturday said its ₹24,713-crore deal with Future Retail Group "cannot be implemented" after the latter's secured creditors rejected it. However, Future Retail's unsecured creditors and shareholders had voted in favour of the scheme. Future Retail in 2020 had announced the ₹24,713-crore deal to sell its retail, wholesale and other assets to Reliance Retail Ventures Ltd.

198.title: BJP will hold early elections in Himachal & Gujarat, claims Kejriwal
198.article_body: Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal claimed that the BJP will hold early elections in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He, however, added that "it doesn't matter whenever BJP conducts elections, power should come in the hands of common man." "BJP is scared of AAP in Himachal and Gujarat...Actually they're scared of the public," he added.

199.title: Delhi government revokes closure notices issued to 400 hotels
199.article_body: Delhi government on Saturday revoked closure notices which Delhi Pollution Control Committee had issued to about 400 hotel owners in the Paharganj and Karol Bagh area. This comes after a delegation of the affected hotel owners met Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai. Earlier, AAP MLA Vishesh Ravi had also written a letter to Rai requesting relief for the hotel owners.

200.title: Will put Karthik ahead of everyone including Pant: Harbhajan on T20 WC 2022
200.article_body: Talking about Team India's potential squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said he will put wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik "ahead of everyone" including Rishabh Pant. "Karthik should be your first choice going to Australia," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan stated that Karthik has been "unbelievable" for RCB in IPL 2022, having looked "quite off-colour" in IPL 2021 for KKR.

201.title: Future Lifestyle Chairman resigns after creditors reject Reliance deal
201.article_body: Future Lifestyle Fashions' Chairman Shailesh Haribhakti has resigned from his position with immediate effect. Citing the "volatile, complex and unpredictable circumstances" of Future Lifestyle, Haribhakti said, "I feel constrained to act further." The development comes a day after the company's secured creditors rejected the deal to sell Future's retail assets to Reliance Industries.

202.title: Success can lead to disillusions, my family are my mentors: Janhvi
202.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that extreme success and extreme failure can lead to many kinds of disillusions, adding that she wants to keep that in check. "I feel it is counterproductive to your growth and as an artist," she added. The actress further said her sisters Khushi and Anshula, her brother Arjun and her father Boney are her mentors.

203.title: Bowlers are getting 'canned' left, right and centre in IPL 2022: Lee
203.article_body: Discussing the partnership of 165 runs off 74 balls between Robin Uthappa and Shivam Dube in CSK's win against RCB, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said, "Dube absolutely pulverised the bowlers...It was brutal...beautiful...unforgettable." "Bowlers are getting canned left, right and centre [in IPL 2022]," added Lee. Dube scored an unbeaten 95 off 46 balls with Uthappa scoring a 50-ball 88.

204.title: It was a full toss, umpire sticked to decision: Samson on no-ball issue
204.article_body: After the no-ball controversy that took place in Friday's match between RR and DC, RR captain Sanju Samson said that the delivery bowled by Obed McCoy was a "full toss". "The umpire gave it a normal ball. But the batsman wanted it as a no-ball. I think the umpire made his decision...and stuck to it," Samson said.

205.title: Sonam will be perfect mom, she'll do even better films afterwards: Anil
205.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor in an interview stated that his daughter actress Sonam Kapoor is a perfectionist, adding that she would be a perfect mother too. He further said that Sonam is all heart and is very generous and very giving. "I'm sure she's going to do even better films after she delivers and gets back to work," the actor added.

206.title: Varun's economy rate is 10 or 11 every game, doesn't get wickets: Chawla
206.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy's economy rate is 10 or 11 in every game, and he doesn't pick wickets as well. Chawla added that KKR's bowling is one of the "main" reasons behind their three consecutive losses. Varun has picked four wickets in IPL 2022 so far. He conceded 30 runs in two overs against RR.

207.title: India Post issues public warning against fake websites
207.article_body: The India Post warned public against fake websites that claim to provide government subsidies through participation in surveys and other means. "We wish to inform...that India Post is not involved in any such activities like announcing subsidies, bonuses or prizes based on surveys, etc," read the Ministry's official statement. It requested the public not to respond to such "spurious messages".

208.title: Old video of 'Bhagwan aur Khuda' poem read by Manoj Bajpayee goes viral
208.article_body: Amid cases of communal tensions in the country, a 2020 video of poem titled 'Bhagwan aur Khuda', featuring Manoj Bajpayee as the narrator, is going viral. Milap Zaveri, who wrote the poem, recently tweeted the video. "Bhagwaan aur Khuda aapas mein baat kar rahe the...ki haath jode huye ho ya dua me uthe, koi farak nhi padta," the poem read.

209.title: Retd TN Police officer leaves loaded pistol with 8 bullets in train, collects it later
209.article_body: A retired senior Tamil Nadu Police official left his pistol loaded with eight bullets in Yercaud Express train and deboarded, an official of Southern Railway said. The loaded pistol was found in the HA1 compartment by a train attendant. On inquiry, it was found retired IGP Ponn Manickavel had travelled in that coach who later came and collected the pistol.

210.title: India wants to be friends with the West, but needs Russia: Sitharaman
210.article_body: India wants to be strong friends with the liberal West but needs Russia's assistance to defend its borders, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said. In an apparent reference to Pakistan and China, Sitharaman said, "You have a neighbour, who joins hands with another neighbour, both of whom are against me." India is the world's top buyer of Russian weapons.

211.title: Putin grounds daughter from holiday over fear she won't return to Russia: Reports
211.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has grounded his eldest daughter from travelling abroad over fear she won't return to Russia, according to reports. Maria Vorontsova wanted to fly to a country for a beach vacation with her partner Yevgeny Nagorny, reports said. Maria has an eight-year-old son with her ex-husband Jorrit Faassen.

212.title: Foetal exposure to medicines can affect newborn's brain: Study
212.article_body: Foetal exposure to medicines like antiepileptics or antidepressants may affect the development of the newborn brain networks, a study has found. The study by University of Helsinki stated that taking antidepressants show effect on local cortical networks while antiepileptics had drug-specific effects on brain-wide networks. These drugs affected brain networks, reactive to changes in sleep stages.

213.title: Family of brain dead woman hit by BMW in Mangaluru donate her organs
213.article_body: The family of 47-year-old Preethi Manoj, who was declared brain dead after meeting a fatal road accident, have decided to donate her organs in Mangaluru. Preethi was riding her two-wheeler when a speeding BMW car hit her after jumping over the divider, leaving her critically injured on April 9. Police have arrested the driver of the BMW car.

214.title: Maharashtra govt spent ₹1.4 crore on its ministers' COVID-19 treatment: RTI
214.article_body: The Maharashtra government has spent ₹1.40 crore for COVID-19 treatment of its ministers since the pandemic began, as per information obtained under the Right to Information (RTI) Act. The state government reportedly cleared bills worth ₹41.38 lakh to Bombay Hospital, ₹26.27 lakh to Lilavati hospital and ₹15.37 lakh to Breach Candy Hospital. Five ministers reportedly spent over ₹10 lakh each.

215.title: Refrain from airing sensational content: Centre issues advisory for TV channels
215.article_body: Expressing concern over the content shown on TV channels, the Centre issued an advisory asking channels to refrain from airing 'misleading and sensational content'. It added, the channels had been making false claims about the Ukraine war and were "aggravating communal tensions" through the coverage of the Jahangirpuri violence. Channels have been using 'scandalous headlines', it added.

216.title: 15-year-old girl raped in West Bengal; 4 including BJP worker arrested
216.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 32-year-old man in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas, police said. The accused, his minor relative, a woman BJP worker and her son were arrested in this connection. The girl's family claimed the BJP worker and her son were guarding her house, where the crime took place, at the time of the incident.

217.title: Man sent flying after car hits his bike in Ghaziabad, CCTV video surfaces
217.article_body: A motorcycle rider was sent flying over the roof of a car that hit the two-wheeler in the Ghaziabad area of NCR. The incident was captured on CCTV footage which showed the man being airborne after being hit by a red car, before landing on the road, in Wave City. He was rushed to the hospital and remains critical.

218.title: Shilpa joins Sidharth in Rohit Shetty's cop series 'Indian Police Force'
218.article_body: Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share that she's going to make her OTT debut with Rohit Shetty's upcoming series, 'Indian Police Force' which also stars actor Sidharth Malhotra. "Ready to set OTT platform on fire for...first time. Super Thrilled to join The Action King Rohit Shetty in his Cop Universe," Shilpa wrote while sharing her look from the series.

219.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz to break into top 10 with win vs Tsitsipas in Barcelona
219.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz will enter world's top 10 rankings for the first time next week after the 18-year-old defeated top-seeded Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-4, 5-7, 6-2 in Barcelona Open quarter-finals on Friday. When 11th-ranked Alcaraz officially enters top 10 on Monday, he'll do so at same age, on same date and following the same tournament as compatriot Rafael Nadal in 2005.

220.title: It is time to make Naya Himachal Pradesh: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal
220.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that it is time to make 'Naya Himachal Pradesh'. Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Kangra, requested the people to give AAP a chance to form government in the state. He added, "I urge all the good people in BJP and Congress to leave their parties and join...AAP."

221.title: HC asks UP police to produce woman allegedly abducted by father
221.article_body: Allahabad High Court has directed Senior Superintendents of Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj and Jaunpur to produce a woman allegedly abducted by her father from the chamber of her advocate by the next date of hearing. It was hearing an inter-caste marriage case. Over 20 men surrounded the chamber and abducted the woman at her father's behest, her advocates claimed.

222.title: Twitter to pilot crypto payments for some users on platform
222.article_body: Twitter and Stripe will pilot cryptocurrency payments for select users of Twitter's Ticketed Spaces and Super Follows programmes. Eligible users will receive their earnings from Twitter in USD coin, a stablecoin backed by the US dollar. The crypto payments will be routed through Stripe Connect. Users will be able to hold their earnings in crypto wallets on the Polygon network.

223.title: Illegal properties of mafias worth ₹268 cr seized in last 2 years in UP: Official
223.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has seized illegal properties worth ₹268 crore in the state belonging to mafias in last two years, Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi said. "When we confiscate any property, we also see whether the construction is legal or not and accordingly action is taken to destroy it which is also called bulldozing," he added.

224.title: Police submit report to court on medical malpractice at Pune hospital
224.article_body: Pune Police have submitted a report to a local court over alleged malpractice at a private hospital during a kidney transplant procedure, an official said. The report was sought by the court after an application was filed by an NGO in the court, the official added. The regional organ transplant authorisation committee has been temporarily suspended over the incident.

225.title: 13-year-old missing girl found dead in swimming pool in Bareilly
225.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was found dead in a swimming pool in the Hafizganj area of Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. According to Additional SP (Rural) Rajkumar Agarwal, the girl reportedly went missing and was found dead three hours after the complaint was lodged. Meanwhile, the deceased's father has accused the swimming pool's owner of murder while the police have launched a probe.

226.title: Yes Bank's Rana Kapoor, DHFL promoters laundered ₹5,050 crore, says ED
226.article_body: Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and DHFL promoters Kapil and Dheeraj Wadhawan laundered money worth ₹5,050 crore, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has claimed in its second supplementary chargesheet. The agency said that Rana Kapoor, the Wadhawans and others were "involved in criminal conspiracy with each other in illegal diversion and siphoning off of funds through suspicious transactions".

227.title: 17-yr-old girl killed by father, brother in honour killing case in UP
227.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly killed by her father and brother in an honour killing case in Uttar Pradesh's Banda on Wednesday, police said. The girl's body was exhumed for a postmortem on Friday which confirmed that she was strangled to death, police added. The girl's family opposed her relationship with a boy of the same caste, police stated.

228.title: Everyone should demand Uniform Civil Code: UP Deputy CM Maurya
228.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Saturday said that everyone should demand and welcome Uniform Civil Code. He said, "UP government is also thinking in this direction...We're in favour of it and it's necessary for UP and...people of [India]." Earlier in March, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami had said his government has decided to implement the Uniform Civil Code.

229.title: India has its own problems: US President while talking about China, Quad
229.article_body: Talking about China and Quad nations (India, Australia, US, Japan), US President Joe Biden said Xi Jinping told him Quad was formed to affect China. "One of the things that autocrats fear the most, and India has its own problems; all those countries have their own problems, is the notion...we can work together...contrary to what are essentially dictatorships," Biden said.

230.title: 55 test COVID-19 +ve at IIT Madras campus so far; no 'XE' variant detected
230.article_body: A total of 55 persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras campus in Tamil Nadu's Chennai in the last few days. "All infected patients have mild symptoms and their condition is stable," state Principal Secretary Health Dr J Radhakrishnan said. According to him, 'XE' variant has not been detected in the state so far.

231.title: GT become first team in IPL 2022 to choose to bat first after winning the toss
231.article_body: GT have become the first team to choose to bat first after winning the toss in IPL 2022. GT captain Hardik Pandya opted to bat first against KKR in their IPL 2022 clash. In the first 34 matches of the tournament, captains had opted to bowl first after winning the toss. KKR have made three changes to their playing XI.

232.title: 5 women, 1 boy of family killed as truck rams into jeep in Maha's Beed
232.article_body: At least five women and a boy of a family from Maharashtra's Latur were killed as the jeep they were travelling in was hit by a truck in Beed district on Saturday, police said. The accident took place around 10.30 am near Saigaon village in Ambajogai tehsil, police added. "Victims were going Ambajogai to attend a programme," police further said.

233.title: There is nobody who is anybody's fan in our house: Anil Kapoor
233.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, speaking about his children actors Sonam and Harsh Varrdhan and producer Rhea, stated that there is nobody who is anybody's fan in their house. He further said that their whole family is very independent and has their own point of view on everything. "I don't want to tell them, 'You do this, you do that'," Anil added.

234.title: Beijing on alert after COVID-19 cases discovered in school
234.article_body: China's capital city Beijing is on alert after 10 middle school students tested positive for COVID-19, in what the officials said was an initial round of testing. Officials have suspended classes in the school for a week. China is currently facing its worst COVID-19 outbreak since the beginning of the pandemic in the central city of Wuhan.

235.title: Trees planted at Pune Airport to mark Earth Day; pics surface
235.article_body: Pune Airport on Friday took to Twitter to share pictures of tree plantation by officials of the Airports Authority of India and SpiceJet on the occasion of Earth Day. One picture shows an official digging the ground to plant a tree sapling. Earth Day is celebrated annually on April 22, since it was first observed in 1970.

236.title: Raj Kundra again spotted wearing outfit entirely covering his face at airport, pics viral
236.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra was again spotted wearing an outfit that entirely covered his face. Reacting to pictures of Kundra in the outfit from Mumbai airport going viral, a social media user commented, "This type of face coverings shouldn’t be allowed for security reasons." Other comments read, "Next generation Spiderman loading" and "Just trying to get attention."

237.title: 236 fibroids removed from woman's uterus in B'luru in new world record
237.article_body: A 34-year-old Bengaluru journalist entered the Guinness Book of World Records after she had 236 fibroids weighing over 2.25 kg, removed from her uterus last year. Ritika Sharma had a four-and-a-half-hour surgical procedure performed on her, in which fibroids as large as a cauliflower were also removed. Fibroids are noncancerous tumours which lead to heavy menstrual bleeding, back pain etc.

238.title: China's top scientist loses $2 bn wealth amid questions over his COVID-19 drug
238.article_body: China's top scientist Wu Yiling's wealth declined by $2 billion after shares of his company, Shijiazhuang Yiling Pharmaceutical, plunged 35% in the past two weeks. The company's stock fell after the son of a Chinese tycoon questioned the efficacy of Wu's drug used to treat COVID-19. The medicine has also been recommended by the Chinese government for treating mild cases.

239.title: 'Himachal too will get honest govt,' Arvind Kejriwal tells CM Jairam Thakur
239.article_body: Replying to Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur's "Delhi's model is not acceptable in Himachal" comment, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said, "Delhi model means honest government." He further asserted, "Like Punjab and Delhi, now AAP will give honest government in Himachal...too." Jairam had earlier said societal and political circumstances in Delhi and Himachal are different.

240.title: Each COVID-19 infected person infecting 2 others in Delhi: IIT Madras study
240.article_body: Delhi's R-value, which indicates the spread of COVID-19, was recorded at 2.1 this week, implying that every infected person is infecting two others, according to an analysis by IIT-Madras. However, Assistant Professor Dr Jayant Jha said it would be too early to declare an onset of another wave. India's R-value, at present, stands at 1.3, the analysis found.

241.title: Video captures moment when shark bites a camera undersea in Maldives
241.article_body: An underwater camera captured what it is like to be eaten by a shark when it bit on a filmmaker’s equipment in the Maldives. The filmmaker was shooting an undersea documentary when a tiger shark took a bite of his 360-degree camera, giving a glimpse into its mouth and throat. However, the shark later released the camera from its jaws.

242.title: UN chief to meet Putin and Zelenskyy next week
242.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres will visit Moscow next week to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and then head to Ukraine for talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Guterres on Tuesday had called for a four-day pause in fighting in Ukraine ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday to allow for the safe passage of civilians from hard-hit areas, but it "wasn't heeded".

243.title: Will induct ground-level leaders from BJP, Cong in Himachal: AAP
243.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Satyendar Jain said that the party will induct ground-level leaders from the BJP and the Congress in Himachal Pradesh. "Only top leaders of BJP and Congress will remain and the rest we will clear. We are doing background checks and will only take good people. AAP will work honestly in Himachal Pradesh," he said.

244.title: Last few years haven't been great for me in terms of my career: Shreyas
244.article_body: Shreyas Talpade has said that the last few years have not been really great for him in terms of his career, adding that he was "pretty much written off". The actor, who was recently seen in 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?', added, "To bounce back is...a blessing. You need to do your work and wait for time to turn around for you."

245.title: Europe saw its warmest summer on record in 2021
245.article_body: Scientists have said that Europe saw its warmest summer on record in 2021, with temperatures a full 1°C higher than the average for the previous three decades. However, the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service found that spring 2021 was cooler than average. Summer was marked by "severe and long-lasting heatwaves" that saw numerous new temperature records.

246.title: Principal has sex with teacher in Chhattisgarh school; suspended after video gets leaked
246.article_body: A principal of a government school in Chhattisgarh's Kanker has been suspended allegedly after a video of him having sex with a teacher in school building surfaced. He was reportedly caught in a sting operation by locals. District Education Officer TR Sahu said a complaint was received in this regard and an investigation was conducted.

247.title: Regular blood donation can remove toxic 'forever chemicals' from body: Study
247.article_body: According to a study donating blood regularly helps in eliminating toxic 'forever chemicals' from the body. 'Forever chemicals', also known as PFAS, are widely present in non-stick kitchenware, water-resistant material and other household products. They enter our body through air, water or food and keep accumulating in blood serum. They impact gut flora or lungs, causing asthma and other diseases.

248.title: Woman falls into open manhole while talking on phone in Bihar, video viral
248.article_body: A video has surfaced online where a woman while talking on her phone, falls into an open manhole in Bihar. The clip showed her walking behind an autorickshaw while talking on the phone and when the vehicle moves forward, she falls into the hole. While the sewer vent was seven to eight feet deep, bystanders managed to rescue her safely.

249.title: 19 crude bombs, pistol found in abandoned auto near children's home in Kolkata
249.article_body: Nineteen crude bombs, a country-made pistol and two cartridges were seized from an abandoned auto-rickshaw near a children's home in Kolkata's Haridevpur, police said. Law enforcers, after receiving a tip-off, conducted a raid and found three abandoned auto-rickshaws on a ground near the home. Investigation is underway to ascertain whether the bombs were part of a terror plot, police added.

250.title: I've a pear-shaped body, was called 'Indian Kardashian' in US: Mrunal
250.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur in an interview said that she has a "pear-shaped body" and she "takes a lot of pride in it". "When I was in US, people said a lot of women pay to get that body," she added. "When someone called me the Indian Kardashian, I was so happy that yes we need to celebrate," Mrunal further said.

251.title: Buttler is after Kohli's record of highest runs in an IPL season: Irfan
251.article_body: Discussing RR opener Jos Buttler's 116 off 65 balls against DC, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Buttler is after Virat Kohli's record of highest runs in [an IPL] season. Flawless batting." Buttler has scored 491 runs in seven IPL 2022 matches so far. Kohli scored 973 runs in IPL 2016 and holds the record for highest runs in a season.

252.title: It was a 'blowout' game for us: SRH's Steyn on 61-run loss against RR
252.article_body: SRH fast bowling coach Dale Steyn said his team's loss by 61 runs in their IPL 2022 opener against RR was a "blowout" game for them. "We will go through some rocky times...hopefully we can handle the situation if it arises," added Steyn. Steyn stated that SRH pacer Umran Malik should be included in Team India "as soon as possible".

253.title: I've no plans to join BJP but I welcome their recent decisions: Hardik Patel
253.article_body: Congress leader Hardik Patel refuted the rumours of him joining BJP and said, "I've no plans to join BJP." "I welcome the political decisions that have been taken by BJP recently. The party is strong in Gujarat as they have leadership with decision-making abilities," he added. Patel further stated that Congress needs to work on its decision-making skills.

254.title: Nepal-based racketeer sentenced to imprisonment in an 8-yr-old case
254.article_body: A Nepal-based racketeer was sentenced to five years of imprisonment in a case, which took place in April 2014, linked to the recovery of Fake Indian Currency Notes (FICN) at the IGI Airport in New Delhi. The National Investigation Agency said that the accused, Abi Ansar, was caught with FICNs of ₹1,000 denomination that had a face value of ₹49,88,000.

255.title: Pic of Watson calming Rishabh Pant down amid no-ball controversy goes viral
255.article_body: A picture of DC assistant coach Shane Watson trying to calm Rishabh Pant down after the latter called batters back amid last-over no-ball controversy has gone viral. During post-match press conference, Watson said, "DC don't stand for what happened in final over [against RR]...Umpire's decision...whether it's right or wrong...we've to accept. Someone running on to the field...it's not acceptable."

256.title: Speeding SUV hits bike, tosses 3 people into air in Delhi; driver held
256.article_body: The driver of a speeding SUV has been arrested after it hit a motorbike and an autorickshaw in Delhi's Saket last week, police said. The car first hit the motorbike, tossing three people on the bike into the air, police said. The accused's vehicle then hit the autorickshaw, police further said. The driver had fled from the spot, police stated.

257.title: Hyd hospital performs new cervical cancer procedure for 1st time in India
257.article_body: Hyderabad's American Oncology Institute has performed India's first hybrid interstitial brachytherapy procedure using Varian's Aarhus Applicator at its Citizens Specialty Hospital. The procedure was successfully performed on two cervical cancer patients, doctors said. "This advanced form of brachytherapy has shown to improve local control and reduce morbidities," a radiation oncologist said.

258.title: Minorities Rights Day to be observed annually on December 18: TN Minister
258.article_body: December 18, every year, will be observed as Minorities Rights Day in Tamil Nadu, Minister for Minorities Welfare and Non-Resident Tamils Welfare Gingee K S Masthan said on Friday. About ₹2.50 lakh will be provided for the purpose, he added. Moreover, a sum of ₹2.75 crore would also be provided as an aid to the students, the minister said.

259.title: Woman robbed in moving Mumbai local train with toy gun; accused arrested
259.article_body: A woman commuter was robbed of ₹4,000 on a moving local train in Mumbai at gunpoint. The weapon used to threaten the victim was reportedly a toy. "The accused also put a hand in my blouse and took away ₹20 which I'd kept aside for rickshaw fare," she claimed. The accused was arrested in 2019 for extorting passengers at knifepoint.

260.title: Bengaluru police arrest 2 thieves, solve 22 cases; gold recovered
260.article_body: Bengaluru police on Friday solved 22 cases of house robberies across the city after arresting two thieves. One of the accused is a habitual offender while the other learnt how to commit theft through YouTube videos, according to police. The police have also recovered gold worth ₹79.64 lakh, three laptops, 10 phones, six iPads and ₹2 lakh cash, among others.

261.title: UK to reopen embassy in Kyiv: PM Johnson after Ukraine's 'success'
261.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson announced that the UK will open its embassy in the Ukrainian capital next week following "the extraordinary fortitude and...success of [Ukrainian] President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and...Ukrainian people in resisting Russian forces in Kyiv". The embassy was temporarily closed days before Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Zelenskyy said he was "grateful" for the UK's decision.

262.title: Reliance bought at least 15 mn barrels of Russian oil since Ukraine invasion: Report
262.article_body: Reliance Industries has ordered at least 15 million barrels of Russian oil since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, said trade sources. It is said that Reliance bought an average of 5 million barrels a month for the June quarter. Before the Ukraine war, Indian refiners, including Reliance, rarely bought oil from Russia owing to its high freight costs.

263.title: Enjoying best form of my life: Buttler after scoring a ton against DC
263.article_body: After scoring a match-winning 116 (65) against the Delhi Capitals, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he is "enjoying the best form" of his life. "Was a special knock, enjoyed it...need to continue with this form all the way through. The ball swung...was a bit tricky...You need to soak up that pressure and come through it," Buttler said.

264.title: Odisha Police looking for woman who hired contract killer to kill husband
264.article_body: Odisha Police are searching for a woman, who hired a contract killer, to eliminate her husband in Bhubaneswar. She is on run ever since her plan didn't materialise. She had reportedly paid ₹1 lakh to the killer, who attacked him with a steel pipe last week. Police have arrested the man's driver, alleged to be her paramour in the case.

265.title: BJP MLA shoes stolen outside temple in UP, wishes well to poor man
265.article_body: BJP MLA Chhotey Lal Verma's shoes went missing while he was inaugurating Mata Sati fair in UP's Agra. The MLA from Fatehabad later walked barefoot back to his car from the temple. Verma said that some poor man must have taken his shoes and added, "I wish Mata Sati to do good to that poor man and keep him happy."

266.title: Tusshar sends me links on parenting, I'm more interested in Lock Upp data: Ekta
266.article_body: Ekta Kapoor in an interview said, "I'm not naturally a parent...My brother (Tusshar Kapoor) is. He's naturally a parent." She added Tusshar sends her links on parenting but she's more interested in reading the data of her show 'Lock Upp'. "I'm very ambitious...I live for my career...I've not moved into my son's life...Rather I've moved him into mine," said Ekta.

267.title: Money laundering case filed against main accused in Jahangirpuri violence
267.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a money laundering case under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) against Ansar Sheikh, the main accused in the Jahangirpuri violence, officials said. This comes after Delhi Police on Friday asked ED to probe the sources of properties of Sheikh. "We suspect he frequently receives money via shady channels," police had said earlier.

268.title: US official praises SpaceX for handling of Russian jamming attack in Ukraine
268.article_body: Director of Electronic Warfare at Office of the Secretary of Defense Dave Tremper has said the way SpaceX Starlink handled Russia's jamming attacks in Ukraine was "eye-watering". Tremper said SpaceX fixed the attack a day after it was reported and suddenly the attack "was not effective" anymore. "We [US] need to be able to have that agility," Tremper said.

269.title: Pant, Buttler involved in heated argument amid no-ball controversy, video goes viral
269.article_body: A video of DC captain Rishabh Pant and RR's Jos Buttler being involved in a heated argument amid no-ball controversy during their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Pant had sent assistant coach Pravin Amre on the field to protest umpires' decision. When Amre was on the ground, Buttler was seen having a heated discussion with Pant on boundary line.

270.title: Will Smith seen in Mumbai in his 1st public appearance after Oscars slap controversy
270.article_body: Actor Will Smith was seen in Mumbai in his first public appearance after the Oscars slap controversy. A video of the actor was shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani on Instagram, which showed Smith waving at his fans. Smith had apologised to comedian Chris Rock after slapping him at Oscars.

271.title: Man hides ₹42 lakh worth gold in rectum, held at Jaipur airport
271.article_body: A man was arrested at Jaipur airport on Friday for illegally concealing 791 gm of gold worth ₹42,79,310 in his rectum, officials said. Yellowish granules packed in three transparent polyethylene capsules were found in the passenger's rectum, officials added. The man, who had arrived from Sharjah, was searched as he looked suspicious due to his manners, an official said.

272.title: 20-year-old man murders landlord in revenge for slap in Gurugram
272.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly murdering his former landlord in revenge for being slapped by him.  The victim's cousin Sandeep said that at around 7.15 pm, Deepak (the landlord) spoke to him near his house and was walking towards his car when the accused arrived on a motorcycle and fired several rounds at him and escaped.

273.title: Don't go to Pakistan for higher education; those degrees not valid in India: UGC
273.article_body: University Grants Commission and All India Council for Technical Education have advised students to not travel to Pakistan for higher education, saying those degrees will not be valid in India. "Migrants and their children who have acquired a higher education degree in Pakistan and have been awarded citizenship by India would be eligible for seeking employment in India," they said.

274.title: Musk rejects philanthropy talks with Bill Gates, pics of their chat surface
274.article_body: A purported text conversation between Elon Musk and Bill Gates has surfaced on social media. While Gates said he wanted to discuss "philanthropy possibilities" with Musk, the latter denied citing Gates' short position against Tesla. Musk also tweeted that he didn't leak the chats and that it wasn't a top secret that Gates was half a billion short against Tesla.

275.title: Musk mocks Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji, Twitter users react
275.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to mock Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji that has been recently rolled out. Sharing a photo of Gates along with the emoji, Musk wrote, "In case you need to lose a boner fast." Reacting to his post, a user wrote, "Is this the guy people want to buy Twitter?"

276.title: Russia wants to capture other countries after Ukraine: Zelenskyy
276.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russia's attack on Ukraine is "only a beginning" and Moscow wants to "capture" other countries. His comments came after Russian military commander Rustam Minnekayev said Moscow is planning to seize Ukraine's south and open a corridor to the Russian-occupied Trans-Dniester region of Moldova, as part of the "second phase" of its military operation.

277.title: BJP glorifies Godse, but foreign VIPs taken to Sabarmati Ashram: Shiv Sena
277.article_body: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece Saamana has commented on BJP over the recent visit of UK PM Boris Johnson to Ahmedabad's Sabarmati Ashram. "It's a wonder that they (BJP) support the ideology of Nathuram Godse but when foreign guests (like Johnson) arrive, they take them to Gandhi's Sabarmati Ashram to weave the yarn," the editorial in Saamana said.

278.title: Newspaper with 'Recognise genocide of Hindus...' article given in Shatabdi; IRCTC reacts
278.article_body: IRCTC has issued a warning to its onboard services licensee, after an unauthorised publication with 'Genocide of Hindus...under Islamic rule needs to be recognised' article was distributed on Shatabdi Express. The licensee said the paper got circulated as a supplement inserted by the vendor into approved newspapers. "The licensee should stick to the contract conditions," IRCTC said.

279.title: 5 of family including 2-year-old girl murdered at home in UP's Prayagraj
279.article_body: Five members of a family, including a two-year-old girl, were found murdered on Saturday at their home in Khevrajpur in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said. The incident took place on Friday when one of the family members had gone to attend a wedding, police added. Injury marks on the bodies suggest all five were hit on the head, police stated.

280.title: Wasn't right but what happened with us was also not right: Pant on sending Amre on field
280.article_body: Talking about him sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on field to protest umpires' decision of not calling a waist-high no-ball in their match against RR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said, "It wasn't right...but what happened with us was also not right." "It was just heat of the moment," he added. Pant stated third umpire should've interfered and signalled a no-ball.

281.title: Google to ban third-party call recording apps from Play Store from May 11
281.article_body: Google is set to introduce a new policy that will block third-party call recording apps from the Play Store from May 11. Such apps currently use the Accessibility API (designed for people with disabilities) to access the audio functions on Android devices. However, phones that come with an in-built call recording feature will still be able to use the function.

282.title: 21-yr-old woman gang-raped by 4 in Rajasthan's Bharatpur
282.article_body: A 21-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by four men at an isolated place in Rajasthan's Bharatpur. They also made a video of the incident and threatened her to make it public if she speaks up. Her father alleged that the accused had kidnapped her at gunpoint. On Wednesday, the girl had left home planning to end her life, police said.

283.title: 21-yr-old TN youth beaten to death by group for being in relationship with girl
283.article_body: A 21-year-old youth died allegedly after a group of people brutally attacked him for being in a relationship with a girl in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur, police said. The youth was attacked by the group that insisted he should stop getting in touch with the girl, police added. An altercation broke out between the victim and the group over the issue.

284.title: Pant fined 100% of match fee, coach Amre banned for one match over no-ball controversy
284.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant has been fined 100% of match fee for breaching IPL Code of Conduct in their match against RR. Pant was seen calling his batters back and sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on to the field to protest umpires' decision of not calling a waist-high no-ball. Amre has been banned for one match.

285.title: Shankar has zero confidence, I would be surprised if GT back him: Chawla
285.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT all-rounder Vijay Shankar has "zero" confidence, adding he would be "surprised" if the franchise continues to back him despite his inability to perform. Shankar has scored 19 runs in four IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 54.28. He has reached double figures only once so far in the ongoing edition.

286.title: MBBS student dies after falling from roof at Odisha medical college
286.article_body: A first-year MBBS student has died after he allegedly fell from the roof of the boys hostel at government-run Bhima Bhoi Medical College and Hospital in Odisha's Balangir, police said. The deceased's family claimed that he was being ragged and had either died by suicide or somebody pushed him. However, the college's dean said, "I've never heard about ragging in...hostel."

287.title: Cong block Prez held in Karnataka cop recruitment scam, 11 held till now
287.article_body: A Congress block President, Mahanthesh Patil, was arrested by the CID (Karnataka) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam. Patil is alleged to have helped another accused, Ayyanna Desai, to cheat during the examination, officials said. The police have arrested 11 people till date, including Desai and Patil, in connection with the recruitment scam held in October 2021.

288.title: Former cricketers react to Pant calling his batters back, RP Singh says 'Not cricket'
288.article_body: Reacting to DC captain Rishabh Pant signalling to call his batters back and sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on to field to protest umpires' decision against RR, ex-India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "Didn't expect Pant could do that...Not cricket." "Bad sportsman spirit on display by DC," wrote Mohammed Azharuddin. "Don't agree with Pant wanting to call...players off," wrote Lisa Sthalekar.

289.title: Punjab govt withdraws security cover of 184 persons including ex-ministers, MLAs
289.article_body: The Punjab government has withdrawn the security cover of 184 persons, including former ministers and MLAs, based on current threat assessment. Personnel deployed on specific orders of the courts, however, would not be withdrawn, as per the official order. Former ministers Bharat Bhushan Ashu, Manpreet Singh Badal, Raj Kumar Verka and Brahm Mohindra are among those who lost security cover.

290.title: Kuldeep relishes the chance to win games for DC, he was unhappy at KKR: Nikhil
290.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "not happy" at his former franchise KKR, adding that KKR did not show confidence in Kuldeep. "Kuldeep is relishing the opportunity to take...wickets and win...[games] for DC," stated Nikhil. Kuldeep is currently IPL 2022's second-highest wicket-taker with 13 wickets so far. He recorded a four-wicket haul against KKR.

291.title: BMC ties up with Google Maps to provide live updates on road closures
291.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a tie-up with Google and its partner Lepton to provide live updates about road closures, congestion on roads and alternate travel routes. Various departments of the BMC like sewage, hydraulics, roads and stormwater drains will provide updates to Google and Lepton, who will then update them on the map on a real-time basis.

292.title: Mentally challenged woman gangraped for 20 hours by 3 men in hospital in Andhra
292.article_body: A 23-year-old mentally challenged woman was allegedly gangraped for 20 hours by three men inside a government hospital in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada. The men were identified as employees of a commercial organisation hired by the hospital to perform fogging work. Police said that the three men have been arrested.

293.title: 'Doctor Strange in the...' banned in Saudi over gay character: Report
293.article_body: Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', starring Benedict Cumberbatch, has been banned in Saudi Arabia due to the inclusion of a gay character, as per The Hollywood Reporter. According to report, the upcoming film will feature a new hero America Chavez, who's gay in the comics. Earlier, Marvel's 'Eternals' was banned in Saudi Arabia for showing same-sex couple.

294.title: 4 arrested over gang-rape of woman colleague in Assam's Guwahati
294.article_body: Four persons, including a private business establishment's owner, were arrested in Assam's Guwahati over involvement in the alleged gang-rape of a woman colleague. Police said the woman claimed three of her colleagues took her to their rented accommodation near their office for lunch and raped her. She allegedly informed the establishment's owner about it, but he didn't take any action.

295.title: Alia has shown that you don't need a hero if you're good enough: Shahid
295.article_body: Shahid Kapoor in an interview praised actress Alia Bhatt, with whom he worked in 'Shaandaar' and 'Udta Punjab'. He said he's "very proud to see how well she has done...in her career and how she has become such a thorough professional". "She has shown...that you don't need...hero if you're good enough, you can hold (movie) on your own," Shahid said.

296.title: Sena workers protest outside MLA-MP couple's home over 'Hanuman Chalisa' warning
296.article_body: Heavy police force was deployed outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence after independent MLA Ravi Rana and his wife independent MP Navneet Rana threatened to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside the premises. Shiv Sena workers on Saturday morning broke through barricades in protest and tried to enter the premises of the couple's residence and dared them to step outside, police said.

297.title: Musk seeks to appeal finding that his 2018 Tesla tweets were false
297.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is seeking to appeal a US judge's finding that his 2018 tweets about taking Tesla private were false. In a filing, Musk's lawyers argued that the judge "parsed the individual phrases of the various tweets and indicated certain other information should have accompanied the tweets". They also highlighted that Twitter has a character limit per tweet.

298.title: 15 booked for assaulting Bajrang Dal worker, 2 others in Gujarat
298.article_body: As many as 15 persons were booked on Friday for allegedly assaulting a Bajrang Dal worker and two others in Gujarat's Surat, police said. One of the victims, who is a tempo driver, was identified as the Bajrang Dal worker's nephew. The alleged assault took place when the victims went to meet another tempo driver to sort out an issue.

299.title: 1 dead, 27 missing after warship sank in Black Sea last week: Russia
299.article_body: One person has died and 27 others are missing after the Russian warship Moskva sank in the Black Sea last week, Russian news agencies said on Friday, quoting the country's Defence Ministry. The warship sank after an explosion and fire that Ukraine said was caused by a successful missile strike. Russia said the sinking was the result of exploding munitions.

300.title: NHRC issues notice to Raj over deaths of 2 infants at govt hospital
300.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday issued a notice to the Rajasthan government over media reports on the deaths of two infants at a government-run hospital in Ajmer due to overheating of warmers. The body said that 20 babies were reportedly in the NICU when the incident occurred. The other babies had "narrowly escaped" death, the NHRC added.

301.title: Facts manipulated: SpiceJet on pilot's claims of being 'off rostered' for reporting fatigue
301.article_body: SpiceJet issued a clarification in response to a pilot's allegations of being 'off rostered' as a punitive action for reporting fatigue. It said the allegations were baseless and that selective emails were leaked to manipulate the facts. The company also said the pilot was on the wrong side of the policies while sharing screenshots of the emails exchanged between them.

302.title: Auto-rickshaw driver molests 12-year-old girl in Pune; booked
302.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked for allegedly molesting a 12-year-old girl after approaching her under the pretext of inquiring about an address in Pune's Bavdhan on Friday, police said. The incident occurred around 3.10 pm when the girl was returning from a private study room, police added. The girl informed her parents, following which her father filed a complaint.

303.title: Retired IAS officer booked for framing incorrect govt records in Guj
303.article_body: A retired IAS officer, SK Langa who was the collector of Gujarat's Panchmahal-Godhra from April 2017 to August 2018, has been booked for allegedly framing incorrect government records. The complaint pertains to multiple land ownership petitions in which he allegedly favoured three applicants. Langa adopted a "pick and choose" method to save people from criminal proceedings, as per the complainant.

304.title: Man attacks girlfriend for rejecting marriage proposal in Telangana
304.article_body: A man in Telangana's Hanamkonda attacked a woman on her neck with a sharp object for allegedly rejecting his marriage proposal. According to police, the woman belonging to a town area would visit her relatives living in the rural area. She had developed acquaintances with the accused from there. Police have started a search operation to arrest the man.

305.title: Man kills wife over 'speaking to someone on phone' in B'luru; held
305.article_body: A 37-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 31-year-old wife in Bengaluru. The accused reportedly told police that he saw his wife speaking to someone on the phone and she didn't "respond properly" when he questioned her, following which he fought and killed her. The incident had occurred on April 17, while the couple's children weren't at home.

306.title: Video of Depp smashing kitchen cabinets shown to court, actor says 'I didn't touch Heard'
306.article_body: An old video recorded by Amber Heard showing Johnny Depp smashing kitchen cabinets while being reportedly drunk was shown to the court amid the actor's defamation suit against his ex-wife. "I did assault a couple of cabinets...but I didn't touch Miss Heard," Depp told the court. "Why was she filming...If she was scared to death...why didn't she leave?" Depp added.

307.title: Pics from IAS 2015 topper Dabi and IAS officer Gawande's wedding reception surface
307.article_body: Pictures from IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi and IAS officer Dr Pradeep Gawande's wedding reception that was held on Friday have surfaced online. The couple got married on April 20, while their reception took place on April 22 in Jaipur. Dabi is currently posted as Joint Secretary Finance (Tax) to Rajasthan government.

308.title: Starlink is our smart & quick solution to restore telecom: Ukraine
308.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov commented on internet connection's state in areas that Russia has left, adding that SpaceX's Starlink is Ukraine's "smart and quick solution to restore telecom". He said Russian soldiers are leaving behind "damaged infrastructure and broken internet connection". A Ukrainian telecom firm is using Starlink as a base station till optical cable gets fixed.

309.title: 'Very clear' we don't want India to rely on Russia for defence needs: US
309.article_body: Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby has said, "We've been very clear with India as well as other nations that we don't want to see them rely on Russia for defence needs." "At the same time, we also value the defence partnership that we have with India...we're looking at ways to improve that going forward," he further said.

310.title: Supply 72,000 tonnes of coal daily to TN: CM Stalin writes to PM Modi
310.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged PM Narendra Modi to direct the coal ministry to deliver 72,000 tonnes of coal per day to the state as per the Fuel Supply Agreement at Paradip and Visakhapatnam ports. "Only this step can enable us to maintain an uninterrupted power supply in the state and hence I solicit your personal intervention," Stalin said.

311.title: Fake and baseless: J&K Police on reports of attack on CRPF bunker in Pulwama
311.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police refuted the rumours of an attack on a CRPF bunker in Tengpora area of Pulwama and called such reports "fake and baseless". "No such incident has taken place," the police confirmed. "General public is requested not to pay heed to the rumours. Rumour mongers shall be dealt with strictly as per law," the police said.

312.title: Rare twin elephant calves born in Karnataka, IFS officer shares video
312.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a video of twins being born to an elephant in Karnataka's Bandipur Tiger Reserve, an event said to be extremely rare. Kaswan added, "They form less than 1% of total births. So encounters and documentations are very rare. Even raising two calves in wild is also difficult for the mother."

313.title: 3 workers die while cleaning sewage tank in Madurai; 3 booked
313.article_body: Three workers allegedly died due to asphyxiation while clearing a blockage in the motor of a 30-foot deep sewage tank in Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Thursday. "There was no ambulance and we took them to...hospital in a two-wheeler," a relative of one of the workers said. An FIR has been registered against three persons who were maintaining the tank.

314.title: Attempt by Shiv Sena, Maha CM to kill me: BJP leader as mob attacks car in Mumbai
314.article_body: BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has alleged that his car was attacked by a mob in Mumbai while returning home from a wedding, near Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence. "This was an attempt to kill me by the Shiv Sena and Maharashtra CM...to suppress my voice," Kamboj said. "Governance in Maharashtra proving to be worse than West Bengal," he added.

315.title: Gunman injures 4 in 'sniper-style' shooting in US before taking own life
315.article_body: A gunman opened fire on random victims from a "sniper-type setup" in an apartment building in the US' capital Washington DC on Friday, injuring four people, before taking his own life as police closed in, officials said. The Van Ness neighbourhood was placed under a lockdown as police mounted a door-to-door search for the 23-year-old suspect, identified as Raymond Spencer.

316.title: Many 'unseen hands, organisations' behind Hubballi violence: K'taka Min
316.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Friday said that "unseen hands" and "certain organisations" were behind the Hubballi violence that took place on April 16. "The Hubballi incident was to incite large-scale violence there," he added. "Some people are trying to create unrest in the society against a particular community...We know who they are...we will find them," Jnanendra further said.

317.title: Car-washing centre sealed for using groundwater in Gurugram, owner booked
317.article_body: A Gurugram-based car-washing station was sealed after the officials, including Haryana CM's flying squad, found it using groundwater for washing the vehicles. The shop owner, Lilu Ram, was booked on the charges of stealing electricity as well and a fine of ₹1.42 lakh was imposed. Notably, car-washing stations are allowed to use treated water or harvested water only.

318.title: Couple, 3 sons try to convert 2 tribal women in Gujarat; arrested
318.article_body: A couple and their three sons were arrested on Friday for trying to convert two tribal women to Christianity in Gujarat's Tapi at their house, a police inspector said. The women were reportedly in a relationship with two of the accused sons. The father told the women that they were "impure" and the ritual will "purify" them, the inspector added.

319.title: Bihar CM Nitish attends RJD's Iftar party; Tej claims 'secret' talk
319.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday attended Iftar party at RJD leader Rabri Devi's residence in Patna and was pictured sitting with the party's Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav and his brother Tej Pratap. Following this, Pratap told ANI, "We'll form a government...I'd a word with Nitish ji secretly." However, Tejashwi said that they'd invited people from all political parties.

320.title: Will never promote religious conversions, PFI should be banned: Goa CM
320.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant criticised Popular Front of India (PFI) over their statement countering his anti-conversion remark and said that he would recommend the Centre to ban the organisation. "We'll never promote religious conversions in the state," he said. PFI had said that people of Goa shouldn't pay attention to the CM's statement and focus on common people's issues.

321.title: With Kapiva Skin Foods, Malaika takes the 30-Day glow challenge
321.article_body: Malaika Arora announced a skin glow challenge to do a photoshoot without make-up after consuming Kapiva's Skin Foods Glow Mix. Within 30 days, it helps boost the production of collagen and glutathione with the goodness of 10+ herbs, claims Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda, adding that it helps to reduce hyperpigmentation, signs of aging, dark circles and boost skin radiance.

322.title: Preity says Madhavan, wife Sarita have 'done a fantastic job' with son Vedaant
322.article_body: Preity Zinta congratulated R Madhavan and his wife Sarita Birje days after their son Vedaant bagged a gold medal at the Danish Open swimming meet. Sharing Madhavan's tweet on Vedaant winning the medal, Preity wrote, "This is such great news. Congrats Madhavan and Sarita. I'm delighted...to see Vedaant shine like this...Both of you have done a fantastic job with him."

323.title: Ukraine postal service faces cyberattack amid Russian warship stamp sale
323.article_body: Ukraine's national postal service Ukrposhta was hit by a cyberattack after the sales of a postage stamp honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" went online. Ukrposhta's Director-General Igor Smelyansky issued an apology to customers. "We are really doing everything...to restore both the online store and other Ukrposhta systems," he added.

324.title: India reports 2,527 COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in last 24 hours
324.article_body: India reported 2,527 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,451 COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,079, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,149.

325.title: Video of MS Dhoni storming on to field resurfaces after DC-RR no-ball controversy
325.article_body: After DC captain Rishabh Pant sent assistant coach Pravin Amre on the field to protest umpires not signalling a waist-high no-ball against RR, a video of CSK's MS Dhoni storming on to the field against RR in IPL 2019 resurfaced. Dhoni had entered the field after the bowler's end umpire overturned a waist-high no-ball decision after consulting with square-leg umpire.

326.title: Allu Arjun praises Yash's KGF 2, says 'A spectacular show by Prashanth Neel'
326.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun took to Twitter to praise Yash's latest release 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. "Swagger performance and intensity by Yash garu...A spectacular show by Prashanth Neel (director) garu. My respect to his vision and conviction," he wrote. Allu Arjun also thanked the team of 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' for "a cinematic experience and keeping the Indian cinema flag flying high".

327.title: New Punjab Cong chief Amarinder Raja fined ₹29,390 over illegal hoardings
327.article_body: Chandigarh Municipal Corporation on Friday fined the new Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee President Amarinder Singh Raja ₹29,390 for allegedly putting up hoardings illegally in the city, without permission. As many as 13 posters and banners, including three big ones, were put up illegally, the civic body said. The corporation's anti-encroachment wing removed the illegal hoardings.

328.title: I don't know who they think they are: Kevin Pietersen on DC over no-ball controversy
328.article_body: Referring to DC captain Rishabh Pant sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on the field and signalling his batters to come back to protest a no-ball decision against RR, Kevin Pietersen said, "I don't know who they think they are." He added, "It was a huge mistake. The biggest mistake was coach running on to the field to talk to umpire."

329.title: BBMP issues ID cards to manual scavengers to help them avail facilities
329.article_body:
The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is issuing identity cards to manual scavengers within the BBMP limits to help them avail rehabilitation facilities from central and state governments. The civic body said that in a resurvey conducted in 2018-19, as many as 1,424 manual scavengers were identified and their data were uploaded on government's Swachhata Abhiyaan
 mobile app.

330.title: Elon Musk registers 3 'X Holdings' companies to support his Twitter offer
330.article_body: Elon Musk has registered three holding companies in Delaware named 'X Holdings' to support his Twitter offer and to potentially bring all his business ventures under one parent company. In 2020, a Twitter user suggested Musk to form an 'X company' that would become the "parent company of Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink and Boring Company", to which Musk responded, "Good idea."

331.title: 20 girls held hostage by 2 female teachers on school roof over transfer order in UP
331.article_body: At least 20 girl students were allegedly held hostage on the roof of their school in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri by two female teachers to pressure the district authorities into cancelling their transfer orders. District basic education officer Laxmi Kant Pandey identified the accused as contractual teachers. The girls were rescued by women police personnel from the local police station.

332.title: Apple actively doing communist China's bidding: US FCC Commissioner
332.article_body: US FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr, while commenting on Apple CEO Tim Cook's speech discussing human rights, said, "Apple is actively doing the bidding of communist China." In a letter addressed to CEO Tim Cook, Carr accused Apple of censoring apps in China to please the government. "I would encourage Apple to evaluate its overall relationship with China," Carr added.

333.title: UK royals share new photos of Prince Louis for his 4th birthday
333.article_body: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Prince William and Kate Middleton, published photographs of their youngest child Prince Louis to mark his fourth birthday. The pictures of Louis, who turned four on Saturday, were taken by Kate and show him smiling, holding a cricket ball, and running along a beach. Prince Louis is fifth in line to the British throne.

334.title: Jairam is a remote-controlled CM: Congress' ex-HP president Sukhu
334.article_body: Congress' former Himachal Pradesh president Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has called Chief Minister Jairam Thakur a remote-controlled CM. "The government is running from Shimla, but the decisions are being taken from Delhi," he said. Sukhu also accused Jairam of being more focused on his party's (BJP) work rather than devoting time to redressal of public grievances.

335.title: First phase of Mumbai-Nagpur Expressway to open on May 2
335.article_body: The 210 km stretch between Nagpur and Shelu Bazar in Washim district will open for public on May 2 while the 310 km phase from Shelu Bazar to Shirdi will start on August 15, MSRDC said. The 700 km-long Mumbai-Nagpur Expressway will reduce travel time between Mumbai and Nagpur to eight hours from the current 16-18 hours, MSRDC chairman said.

336.title: Day temperature in Pune to remain around 40 °C; IMD predicts light rainfall
336.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Pune might witness light rainfall along with thunderstorm activity till April 28. Pune on Friday reported the day temperature at 39.4°C. The head of the weather forecasting department at IMD said that the day temperature in the city will remain around 40°C for the next few days.

337.title: Heatwave to return next week in Delhi, max temp to reach 44°C-mark: IMD
337.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that the heatwave will return in Delhi next week and added that the maximum temperature is likely to touch the 44°C-mark by Thursday. The national capital in April 2022 has witnessed eight heatwave days, the maximum since April 2010. Delhi on Tuesday recorded a temperature of 42.6°C, the highest in April in 11 years.

338.title: Sri Lanka Police transfer 3 top officers over protester's death
338.article_body: The Sri Lanka Police have transferred three top officers for their alleged misconduct which led to the death of an unarmed protester in Rambukkana. The protester died after police opened fire at people demonstrating against the latest fuel price hike earlier this week amid the nation's worst economic crisis. A special team has also been appointed to probe the incident.

339.title: Billionaire CEO of Russia's 2nd largest oil company quits after facing sanctions
339.article_body: Russian billionaire oligarch Vagit Alekperov has resigned as CEO of Lukoil, the second-largest oil company in the country. While Lukoil didn't mention a reason for this, his resignation comes a week after sanctions were imposed on him by the UK and EU. As per Forbes, Alekperov is estimated to be worth $18.1 billion.

340.title: US Republicans ask Twitter to retain records tied to Musk's offer
340.article_body: A group of 18 House Republicans in the US has asked Twitter board members to preserve all records and materials relating to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer. The members have been asked to preserve any message from official or personal accounts, including through encryption software. Their letter said Twitter's reactions to the offer are "concerning".

341.title: DCB Bank launches rainwater recharge wells project in Bengaluru
341.article_body: DCB Bank has inaugurated a sustainability project of 25 rainwater-recharge wells in Bengaluru's Jalahalli. The project aims to restore the groundwater and also provide livelihood opportunities to the Manu Vaddar community (traditional well diggers). "The rainwater recharge well is a very powerful tool to manage groundwater for a city - especially Bengaluru," a DCB Bank official said.

342.title: Video shows crowd chanting 'cheater' after umpires don't signal no-ball in DC-RR match
342.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing the crowd at Wankhede Stadium chanting 'cheater, cheater' after the umpires didn't signal a waist-high no-ball in DC's last over against RR. The umpires also refused to refer to the third umpire to check whether Obed McCoy's full-toss delivery to Rovman Powell was above waist height.

343.title: Fans question whether RR's full-toss against DC in last over was no-ball or not
343.article_body: RR pacer Obed McCoy was smashed for a six on a full-toss by DC's Rovman Powell in the last over. After the umpires didn't signal it a waist-high no-ball, DC protested with the match being halted for a while. "It was a clear no-ball," a fan tweeted. Another wrote, "Not a no-ball...Powell is outside his crease and the ball's dipping."

344.title: Monkey tries to kidnap 3-yr-old girl, drags her on road in viral video from China
344.article_body: A 3-year-old girl was attacked and almost kidnapped by a wild monkey in a village in China's Chongqing Municipality. An initial investigation revealed that the monkey had previously attacked local villagers on multiple occasions. A viral video shows the girl playing with a scooter when the monkey throws her on the ground and drags her away.

345.title: Will intensify anti-encroachment drives: Delhi civic bodies' mayors
345.article_body: South and East Delhi Municipal Corporations' mayors said they will intensify anti-encroachment drives in their jurisdictions. "We're holding regular meetings...Not a single encroacher will be spared," SDMC Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan said. "We've identified several areas...directed deputy commissioners of Shahdara North and South zones to make detailed roadmaps," EDMC Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal said.

346.title: Rajasthan Royals record their highest-ever partnership in IPL
346.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) on Friday recorded their highest-ever partnership for any wicket in IPL. Jos Buttler and Devdutt Padikkal shared a 155-run opening stand against DC to set the record. The previous record was held by Ben Stokes and Sanju Samson, who shared an unbeaten 152-run stand for third wicket against MI on October 25, 2020.

347.title: Maha govt gives ₹87 crore for Lahuji Vastad Salve memorial in Pune
347.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Friday handed over ₹87 crore for land acquisition to build the Krantiveer Lahuji Vastad Salve memorial at Pune's Sangamwadi. State Deputy CM Ajit Pawar presented a cheque for the same during an event organised by the social welfare department. Salve is believed to be one of the many forgotten freedom fighters, reported Hindustan Times.

348.title: Shanghai to fit door alarms to stop people with COVID-19 from leaving home
348.article_body: Amid the rising COVID-19 cases, Shanghai authorities will now fit electronic door alarms in order to prevent infected people from leaving their homes.
