Earlier, hundreds of residents were forcibly evacuated from their homes so as to allow authorities to disinfect their buildings. The city officials have also said that all the disinfection measures will be escalated in the worst-hit areas.

349.title: Mumbai woman spots molester after 3 months at railway station, gets him arrested
349.article_body: A 21-year-old woman, who was allegedly molested by a 52-year-old man on the pretext of helping her buy a long-distance train ticket in January, got him arrested after spotting him near the ticket counter at a railway station. Earlier in January, the accused had allegedly  taken her in a taxi and molested her in the vehicle, police said.

350.title: Pant calls batters back, sends coach Amre on the field to protest no-ball decision
350.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant was seen calling his batters back after umpires decided not to check for a potential waist-high no-ball with the third umpire in last over against RR. Pant sent assistant coach Pravin Amre on field to protest the decision. DC then decided to continue with the innings and went on to lose the match by 15 runs.

351.title: RR defeat DC by 15 runs to jump to the top of IPL 2022 points table
351.article_body: RR defeated DC by 15 runs in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday to jump to the top of the points table. RR put up a total of 222/2 in their 20 overs, the highest total in the tournament so far. DC were restricted to 207/8 in their 20 overs. RR's Jos Buttler smashed a hundred in the match.

352.title: Maharashtra reports 121 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths reported
352.article_body: Maharashtra on Friday reported 121 new COVID-19 cases taking its cumulative tally to 7,876,503, the latest health department bulletin showed. There was no fresh casualty reported in the state, which means the overall death toll remains at 1,47,831. This was for the fourth day Maharashtra saw more than 100 new cases in a single day.

353.title: Not even 1 poll promise fulfilled by Punjab AAP govt so far: Chugh
353.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh on Friday said the AAP government in Punjab hasn't fulfilled 'even a single poll promise' so far. He claimed that the party's promised immediate implementation of 300 units of free electricity has now been pushed back till July. He also accused AAP of using the state's resources to fulfil political motives in other states.

354.title: Centre to chalk roadmap for pharma, medical devices: Mandaviya
354.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that the central government will engage with industry and academia to chalk a roadmap for pharma and medical devices for the next 25 years. "India shall soon get the competitive edge in medical devices with research and innovation," he said ahead of the 7th edition of India Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices Conference 2022.

355.title: Suman Bery named NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson as Rajiv Kumar steps down
355.article_body: Economist Dr Suman K Bery has been appointed the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog after Dr Rajiv Kumar stepped down from his post on Friday. Kumar took over as Vice Chairperson in 2017 after his predecessor Arvind Panagariya exited the government think-tank to return to academics. Bery was the Director-General of National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER) from 2001-2011.

356.title: Help shopkeepers threatened by BJP: Manish Sisodia to AAP MLAs
356.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia directed Aam Aadmi Party MLAs to help landlords and shopkeepers. He alleged that some people associated with BJP are 'threatening them by running bulldozers at their shops if they don't pay them money'. He wrote a letter to AAP MLAs saying that they can also register a complaint against such people.

357.title: Chahal's mindset has made him a world-class bowler: Lalchand Rajput
357.article_body: Talking about Yuzvendra Chahal, who is currently the leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022, Lalchand Rajput said the RR spinner's mindset and attitude are transforming him from a good bowler into a world-class bowler. "The way he runs before going to bowl, tells how much confidence he has. The graph has certainly improved for Chahal," he added.

358.title: Odisha Police organise wedding of 2 former Naxals
358.article_body: Odisha's Kalahandi district police on Friday organised the wedding of two former Naxals, who were earlier associated with a Maoist group. The bride and the groom, aged 25 and 29 respectively, had surrendered and lived on the police reserve campus. "Since both...have been with us for so long, we decided to make it...police family function," the police superintendent said.

359.title: 200 more mass graves found near Ukraine's Mariupol, satellite pic released
359.article_body: A satellite picture shared by US firm Maxar Technologies has claimed to show 200 more mass graves near the Ukrainian city of Mariupol, amid Russia's invasion of the country. Local officials have accused Russia of burying up to 9,000 Ukrainian civilians in the town of Manhush outside Mariupol. Russia had on Thursday claimed victory in the battle for Mariupol.

360.title: Cong wants to break trend of Raj govt changing every 5 yrs: Pilot
360.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the party is aiming to retain power in the 2023 Rajasthan Assembly polls and break the 30-year-old tradition of the government changing in the state every five years. Pilot, who met Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday said that the latter is "very keen...we all work unitedly to form government in Rajasthan again".

361.title: After COVID-19, Goa is the safest destination for tourists: CM
361.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said that after COVID-19, Goa is the safest destination for tourists. The Goa CM said that with the help of the PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government, Goa is set to promote spiritual and medical tourism based on public-private partnership. He also praised the central government for giving a boost to Goa shipyards.

362.title: I was completely broken: Isha Koppikar on losing film after refusing to meet a star alone
362.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar, speaking to Bollywood Hungama, recalled an incident wherein a star had told her he wanted to meet her without her staff. The actress had refused to do so and was dropped from the film, she said. "I was completely broken. More than broken, disillusioned...because...I didn't know...you had to be in the good books of heroes," Isha stated.

363.title: Man paddleboards to work in UK, saves over ₹2 lakh a year in petrol & parking costs
363.article_body: Alex Kell, a financial planner from Gloucester, paddleboards to work that helps him save around £2,500 (more than ₹2 lakh) over a year in petrol and parking costs. "I've paddleboarded for about five or six years," he told Euro News. "Commuting to work on a paddleboard is pretty peaceful," Kell further stated.

364.title: Cong snatched rights of Himachal Pradesh, BJP safeguarded it: Nadda
364.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda, while addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra on Friday, said that Congress has always snatched the rights of the state while the BJP government has safeguarded the rights. He said, "Congress leaders only talk about dynastic politics, casteism, communalism...But PM Narendra Modi has taken development forward by giving a tough competition to all this."

365.title: I look up to Big B, Ajay Devgn: CarryMinati on doing 'Runway 34'
365.article_body: YouTuber CarryMinati, who will make his Bollywood debut in Ajay Devgn and Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Runway 34', has said that the actors are personalities he looks up to. He further said that he agreed to be a part of the film because he essays his own character (CarryMinati). "I eat, breathe, sleep and live my character every single day," he added.

366.title: Fans claim 'Moon Knight' theme similar to 'Mahabharat' title track
366.article_body: A video claiming that the background score of Marvel series 'Moon Knight' is very similar to the title track of Indian television series 'Mahabharat' is going viral on social media. The background score for 'Moon Knight' has been composed by Egyptian composer Hesham Nazih. This comes after fans claimed that there were similarities in scenes of 'Shang-Chi' and Bajirao Mastani'.

367.title: How is Josh in IPL 2022, Buttler sir: RP Singh on RR opener's 3rd ton
367.article_body: Following opener Jos Buttler's third century for RR in IPL 2022, RP Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "How is the Josh in IPL 2022? Buttler sir!" Michael Vaughan tweeted, "No one is anywhere close to batting like Buttler in T20 cricket at the moment...Incredible." Buttler scored 116 runs in 65 balls against DC at Wankhede Stadium on Friday.

368.title: Hardik is necessary for India in T20 World Cup 2022: Manjrekar
368.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said all-rounder Hardik Pandya should be included in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia as the team might need a back-up seamer. "Hardik is necessary because India have three seamers who are likely to play," he added. Manjrekar further said Hardik can be sixth bowling option as he has done well in Australian conditions before.

369.title: Bomb blast at mosque during Friday prayers kill 33 people in Afghanistan
369.article_body: A blast at a Sunni mosque during Friday prayers killed at least 33 people in Afghanistan's Kunduz. Zabihullah Mujahid, Taliban spokesperson, confirmed the death toll on Twitter and said 43 people had also been wounded. "The perpetrators of these incidents are...evil elements and serious efforts are being made to arrest and punish them," he said.

370.title: Haryana to host grand 400th Parkash Purab celebration on April 24
370.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced that the state government is going to host a grand celebration in Panipat on April 24 to mark the 400th Parkash Purab of the ninth Sikh Guru Tegh Bahadur. As part of the preparations for the event, a cleanliness drive was carried out in Panipat on Friday morning.

371.title: Issue red corner notice against man who broke orders: HC to CBI
371.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed the CBI to take steps against a man, Karan Goel, who violated the conditions imposed on him by the court. The court asked the CBI to issue a red corner notice against him for taking his daughter to Nepal. It directed Goel to produce his daughter before the court on the next day of hearing.

372.title: Minor among 2 arrested over communal riots in Gujarat's Khambhat
372.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, have been booked in connection with the April 10 riots in Gujarat's Khambhat, police said. The pair were caught from the Yakutpura area by the Vadodara Prevention of Crime Branch on Friday based on a tip-off. The communal clashes that broke out during Ram Navami processions had left one person dead and several injured.

373.title: He'll become England's T20 captain soon: Vaughan on Buttler
373.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said Jos Buttler is best T20 player in the world and soon he'll become England T20 captain. "If not for this [T20] World Cup, definitely for...next one. He's that sort of a cricketer," he added. Vaughan further said that RR's decision to retain Buttler this season was a "no-brainer". Buttler is currently the leading-scorer in IPL 2022.

374.title: 300-yr-old temple demolished in Rajasthan; 'idols were shifted out', says official
374.article_body: A 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar on Friday, with a video of the demolition being widely shared online, triggering a political row. DM Shivprasad Nakate said the demolition was done to remove illegal encroachments and the temple's idols were shifted to another place by priests. Rajasthan minister Shanti Dhariwal said it was the municipal council's decision.

375.title: Notice to MP over Hanuman Chalisa recitation outside Maha CM's house
375.article_body: After MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana said they plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside the residence of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, they were sent a notice by the Mumbai Police. The notice was sent under Section 149 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, which allows the police to act in the interest of preventing cognisable offences.

376.title: Pic shows Johnny Depp 'passed out' on couch with ice cream spilled on his lap
376.article_body: The jury hearing actor Johnny Depp's defamation suit against ex-wife Amber Heard was shown a series of images on Thursday, including a photo of him 'passed out' on a couch with ice cream spilled on his lap. He said Heard took the photo in Boston in 2014. A picture of four large bags of marijuana was also shown.

377.title: Jos Buttler smashes joint-most sixes in an IPL 2022 match
377.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has equalled the record for smashing the most number of sixes in an IPL 2022 match. The 31-year-old smashed nine sixes in his knock of 116(65) against DC on Friday. He equalled the record set by CSK opener Robin Uthappa, who had slammed nine sixes against RCB on April 12.

378.title: Imran Khan praises India, says 'India thinks for its own people before other nations'
378.article_body: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan praised India at a rally, saying that India "thinks for its own people before benefit of other countries". "India, is a strategic ally of US, is taking oil from Russia. When New Delhi was told to not buy the oil, it straightaway said 'we take decisions based on what's good for our country'," Khan said.

379.title: RR smash the highest total of IPL 2022, break their own record
379.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) on Friday registered the highest total of IPL 2022 so far after recording 222/2 in their 20 overs against Delhi Capitals (DC). Jos Buttler top-scored for RR with 116(65), while his opening partner Devdutt Padikkal scored 54(35). The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 217/5 registered by RR against KKR on Monday.

380.title: Future Retail's secured lenders reject deal to sell retail assets to Reliance
380.article_body: Future Retail said on Friday that nearly 70% of its secured creditors have rejected the ₹24,713-crore deal to sell the group's retail assets to Reliance Industries. Its unsecured creditors and shareholders, however, approved the deal, Future said in an exchange filing. The company has failed to receive the requisite 75% favourable votes from secured creditors for the deal, reports said.

381.title: Many unseen hands behind Hubli violence: Karnataka Home Minister
381.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Friday said that many "unseen hands" were behind the recent violence in Hubli. "Some people are trying to create unrest in...society against a particular community and some organisations are involved in it. We're aware who they are," Jnanendra added. Four policemen were injured and several vehicles were damaged in the April 16 stone-pelting incident.

382.title: IAS officer shares pic of 'solution' after tweet on gutkha-laced saliva on Howrah Bridge
382.article_body: After IAS officer Awanish Sharan's viral tweet on gutkha-laced saliva corroding Howrah Bridge, he shared a picture of measures taken by Kolkata Port trust to solve the issue. It showed a partially red painted pillar being covered. "Now those who spit gutka won't have to face any 'guilt'...The bridge can also be protected from 'harmful chemical of gutka'," he tweeted.

383.title: Don't have any interest in leading England Test team: Morgan
383.article_body: England's limited-overs skipper Eoin Morgan said he doesn't have any interest in leading the Test team after Joe Root quit captaincy recently. "I'm very happy with the role that I play within the white-ball team and English cricket at the moment...my career is firmly focused on World Cups," he added. Morgan hasn't played a Test match since February 2012.

384.title: Witness in wife's murder case shot dead in Haryana court complex
384.article_body: A man, who was a prime witness in his wife's murder case, was shot dead inside Haryana's Sonipat district courts complex by two armed men on Friday. Ved Prakash's wife, Kanika, was allegedly strangled to death and thrown into a canal by her father who was against their marriage. Police are trying to ascertain if both the deaths are linked.

385.title: PM Modi intervened many times with Putin to ask what on earth he's doing: UK PM
385.article_body: Speaking about Russia-Ukraine war, UK PM Boris Johnson said, "Talking to PM Narendra Modi today, it's clear that he has...intervened several times with Vladimir Putin to ask him what on earth he thinks he is doing." "What the Indians want is peace and they want the Russians out. And I totally agree with that," Johnson on PM's intervention.

386.title: 10-ft-long squid washes ashore alive in Japan in rare sighting, video surfaces
386.article_body: In a rare sighting, a giant squid was found stranded alive on a shore in western Japan on Wednesday. The squid measuring around 10 feet was found stranded at Ugu beach in Obama of Fukui Prefecture and a video of the same has been shared online. Squids of this size are deep-sea dwelling creatures.

387.title: There's 'realistic possibility' Russia could win war in Ukraine: UK PM
387.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Friday said that there is a "realistic possibility" that Russia could win its war in Ukraine. He, however, said that "no matter what military superiority" Russian President Vladimir Putin had, he would not be able to "conquer the spirit of the Ukrainian people". "We've...got to keep intensifying the economic sanctions [against Russia]," PM Johnson added.

388.title: T20 is a cruel format, MI need to grab crunch moments: Tendulkar
388.article_body: Calling T20 format "cruel" following MI's seven-match losing streak in IPL 2022, mentor Sachin Tendulkar said the team needs to conquer the crunch moments to win the matches. "Those crucial moments in a match which don't go in your favour then literally the margin is like you lose a game by two or three runs...sometimes even [on]...last ball," he added.

389.title: Jos Buttler becomes second player in IPL history to smash 3 hundreds in a season
389.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has become the second player after Virat Kohli in IPL history to smash three hundreds in a season. The 31-year-old achieved the feat after reaching the three-figure mark off 57 deliveries against DC on Friday. Buttler's other two hundreds in IPL 2022 came against MI and KKR. Kohli had slammed four hundreds in IPL 2016.

390.title: Delhi reports 1,042 new COVID-19 cases & 2 deaths, positivity rate at 4.6%
390.article_body: Delhi on Friday reported 1,042 fresh COVID-19 cases as compared to 965 cases on Thursday. The city also recorded 2 COVID-19 related deaths in the last 24 hours, while 757 people recovered from the disease in one day. The national capital's daily COVID-19 positivity rate is at 4.64% as compared to Thursday's 4.7%.

391.title: NASA has become an ATM machine to fuel Musk, Bezos' space race: Sanders
391.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders has expressed his concerns over NASA providing subsidies to private space companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin. He said, "NASA has become...an ATM machine to fuel a space race...between the two wealthiest men in America - Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos." Sanders added that space exploration can make the richest people in the world incredibly richer.

392.title: If anyone else was earning, mom Shweta would stay home: Palak
392.article_body: Palak Tiwari has stated her mother Shweta Tiwari has always been a sole earner, adding she wants to earn to provide for her half-brother Reyansh's education. "If anyone else was earning...in the family, she would've stayed home with him," Palak said. Palak is Shweta's daughter with first husband Raja Chaudhary and Reyansh is her son with second husband Abhinav Kohli.

393.title: Protesters remove SilverLine project survey stones in Kerala
393.article_body: Protesters on Friday removed survey stones that were laid by K-Rail officials for the SilverLine semi-high speed rail project in the Edakkad area in Kerala's Kannur district. This comes a day after clashes broke out between Congress workers and police in Thiruvananthapuram during a protest against the project. The project is estimated to cost around ₹60,000 crore.

394.title: Mysuru man strangles 31-yr-old wife to death over alleged affair
394.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his 31-year-old wife to death in Karnataka's Mysuru district following an argument over her mobile addiction and an alleged affair. The crime came to light three days later when the victim's brother went to meet her on Wednesday and found a foul smell emanating from the house. The accused has confessed to the crime, police said.

395.title: Kohli has the best cover drive between him and Babar: Buttler
395.article_body: On being asked who has the best cover drive between Virat Kohli and Babar Azam, RR opener Jos Butter replied, "I am going to say Kohli." Notably, Kohli has failed to score a century in his last 100 matches across all formats. The RCB batter has so far scored 119 runs from seven matches in ongoing IPL.

396.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹6 crore of Saradha Group of Companies
396.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth ₹6.28 crore of Saradha Group of Companies in Assam under provisions of Prevention of Money Laundering Act, the agency said. According to ED, the Saradha Group of Companies ran illegal ponzi schemes by befooling people. The companies had invested in various movable and immovable properties to launder the proceeds of crime, a probe revealed.

397.title: Pic from IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's wedding with IAS officer Pradeep Gawande surfaces
397.article_body: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi got married to Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer in a private ceremony in Jaipur on Wednesday. A picture from the wedding, in which a photograph of Dr BR Ambedkar can also be seen in the background, has surfaced online. The couple reportedly sent out invitations for a reception on April 22.

398.title: Momentum is lost: Poonawalla on COVID-19 vaccination pace in India
398.article_body: SII CEO Adar Poonawalla has called for the lowering of the vaccination gap to six months from nine months. "Taking decisions on time as we did during the second wave is the need of the hour," said Poonawalla on vaccination. "But, unfortunately for the key people...it seems there's no urgency...The momentum...that brought us...here is lost...it's business as usual," he added.

399.title: Bride secretly laces wedding food with weed, arrested after guests fall sick in US
399.article_body: A 42-year-old bride and her 31-year-old caterer were arrested after they allegedly laced food on the wedding menu with weed secretly, leading to some guests getting hospitalised in US' Michigan. The wedding which took place in February was attended by 50 guests. The groom said the wedding guests were not aware about marijuana-laced desserts and lasagna.

400.title: Anand Mahindra shares photos taken by him on Earth Day
400.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday shared images of different places that he had photographed. "I don't have any sermons to share today, on #EarthDay...some photographs I've taken over the years. My own personal celebration of this planet...Do share your celebratory photos," he wrote. Several Twitter users replied in the comments section by sharing pictures taken by them.
